title: Warehouse Manager
description:
Job Summary: WAREHOUSE MANAGER with WMS Skill

The Warehouse Manager is responsible for overseeing all warehouse operations, ensuring efficient processes, and maintaining a safe and organized work environment. The role involves managing inventory, coordinating shipments dispatches, Schedule Drivers for routes, supervising staff, and implementing warehouse best practices.

Responsibilities:

**Strategic Planning:**

Develop and implement warehouse operations policies and procedures to optimize efficiency and productivity.

Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless integration of warehouse activities into overall business operations.

**Inventory Management:**

Maintain accurate inventory records through regular cycle counts and reconciliation.

Implement inventory control measures to minimize loss, damage, and discrepancies.

**Order Fulfillment:**

Oversee the picking, packing, and shipping of orders in a timely and accurate manner.

Coordinate with logistics partners to ensure on-time deliveries.

**Staff Management:**

Recruit, train, and supervise warehouse staff.

Schedule and assign tasks to warehouse employees, ensuring optimal staffing levels.

**Safety and Compliance:**

Enforce safety protocols and ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations.

Conduct regular safety training sessions for warehouse staff.

**Routing Local Order – Tristate orders**

Ensuring that Drivers are on weekly schedule for daily local routes of shipments

Maintaining driver’s expenses, hours, truck maintains sheet, schedule trucks for regular PM and ensuring safety of box trucks for driver going on long routes.

**Equipment Maintenance:**

Coordinate maintenance and repairs of warehouse equipment.

Ensure that all equipment is operating safely and efficiently.

**Space Utilization:**

Optimize warehouse layout to maximize storage capacity and facilitate efficient operations.

Implement space-saving and organizational strategies.

**Reporting and Analysis:**

Generate regular reports on key performance indicators (KPIs) and warehouse metrics.

Analyze data to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Trenton, NJ 08619: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

description:

title: Analyst Advertising Operations
description:
We are UMG, the Universal Music Group. We are the world’s leading music company. In everything we do, we are committed to artistry, innovation and entrepreneurship. We own and operate a broad array of businesses engaged in recorded music, music publishing, merchandising, and audiovisual content in more than 60 countries. We identify and develop recording artists and songwriters, and we produce, distribute and promote the most critically acclaimed and commercially successful music to delight and entertain fans around the world.  

How we LEAD:
Universal Music Group – the world leader in music and culture – has created a powerful suite of digital media solutions that are leveraged by today’s biggest brand marketers. To support this new and rapidly growing revenue stream, we are building a dedicated client services team to help facilitate the activation and success of media sales. We are looking for a passionate and determined individual to join the client services team to help grow and develop our existing media sales efforts, while ensuring the foundations are in place for further development of our team and products into the near future.
UMG has the largest footprint in music media, with advertising solutions across online video, data and social.
How you’ll CREATE:* Facilitate technical set up, activation and execution of media sales campaigns globally within digital advertising platforms.
* Collaborate with sales planning team to communicate all necessary client deliverables for campaign set up including creative specifications, content guidelines, measurement requirements and more.
* Effectively communicate the technical nuances of UMG’s media suite to sales planning teams.
* Collaborate with technical stakeholders internally and externally to identify ways to automate campaign set up processes and bring innovation to our media activation infrastructure.
* Coordinate with finance leads to verify actualized delivery for each campaign.
* Forecast network traffic and strategically identify ways to release inventory for prospective clients while still satisfying the needs of current clients.
* Review all client deliverables to ensure creatives are built to spec and align with platform guidelines.
* Monitor performance of ongoing campaigns to ensure a full delivery of impressions and to optimize for success against client performance goals.
* Troubleshoot technical issues that arise with campaign activation, performance and delivery.
* Generate campaign reporting to share with the sales planning team, including analysis as needed.


Bring your VIBE:* You are deeply passionate about music and knowledgeable about the media landscape, with a desire to find synergies between the two.
* You are a proficient communicator with the ability to build and maintain good working relationships across a variety of internal & external stakeholders.
* You are a strategic thinker who is driven by finding unique solutions to client challenges.
* You are detail-oriented and strive to consistently deliver high quality work in everything you do.
* You are a tenacious and driven self-starter, who feels at home on a small team and is comfortable working independently.
* You are a dependable team member that is comfortable with working in a fast-paced environment.
* You understand media pricing models and the math behind them.
* You are highly skilled in building presentations, process documents and media plans using Microsoft Powerpoint, Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Apple Keynote.
* You are passionate about advertising technology and have a strong working knowledge of media platforms including Google Ad Manager, Google Ads, Meta Business Manager, Spotify Ad Studio, Twitter Ads, TikTok Ads Manager, Google Display & Video 360, and more.
* You are experienced with implementing ad serving technologies and measurement technologies from partners including Google Campaign Manager, Innovid, Flashtalking, DoubleVerify, Integral Ad Science and more.
* 3-5 years of prior media experience is preferred.
* Prior experience in client services/account management roles is preferred.
* Prior experience in programmatic media buying or sales is preferred.


Perks Playlist:* Be part of an entrepreneurial, global organization that values authenticity, drive, creativity, relationships, and a competitive spirit
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and FSA options, as well as:
	+ 100% coverage for out-patient mental health services
	+ Wellbeing reimbursements for fitness classes, spa treatments, meal services, travel, and so much more (up to $720/year)
	+ A lifetime fertility support allowance of $30,000 to plan participants
	+ Student Loan Repayment Assistance and Tuition Reimbursement
	+ 100% immediately vested 401(k) match on the first 5% of your contribution on eligible compensation

* Variety of ways to prioritize much-needed time away from work including:
	+ Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) for exempt employees
	+ 3-weeks PTO for non-exempt employees
	+ 2-weeks paid Winter Break
	+ 10 Company Holidays (including Juneteenth and Wellbeing Day)
	+ Summer Fridays (between Memorial Day and Labor Day)
	+ Generous paid parental leave for every type of parent


Check out our full overview of benefits on the Perks Playlist page of the career site.

title: Retirement Investment Strategist
description:
Retirement Investment Strategist

Job Number:

 3257928


POSTING DATE: Sep 3, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Executive Director

DESCRIPTION


Firm Overview

Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.
As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career—a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.
Responsibilities include:
+ Lead strategic asset allocation process working across Portfolio Managers to design Institutional retirement investment solutions and manage client portfolios for OCIO’s defined benefit and defined contribution clients.
+ Engage with internal advisors, consultants and clients on multi-asset portfolio strategies, liability driven investing solutions, risk budgeting and management, asset allocation, manager selection, portfolio construction and pension/investment education materials
+ Coordinate with clients to secure relevant actuarial and demographic information to complete asset liability and related studies and integrate results into investment strategies and asset allocation.
+ Engage with clients to perform client discovery, draft investment policy statements, provide quarterly reporting, and other tasks relevant to the DB/DC space
+ Ensure the smooth-functioning of administrative and operational activities, including those involving outside custodians and trading, reporting, and client cash flows
+ Contribute to new business efforts by attending and presenting to prospective clients; assisting in customization of RFP answers as well as other sales/marketing efforts
+ Along with other subject matter experts; help create commercial institutional intellectual capital for advisors to use with clients and prospects to engage on topics related to the areas of expertise

QUALIFICATIONS


Knowledge and Skills Required:
+ 10+ years of actuarial and/or investment consulting experience servicing retirement, corporate and other institutional accounts. FSA, ASA or EA designation strongly preferred. CFA a plus.
+ Experience and knowledge in investment/ wealth management platforms and vehicles, including managed account platforms, mutual funds, ETFs, separate accounts, and alternative investments
+ Experience and knowledge in global capital markets, technical expertise across asset classes preferred
+ Firm understanding of portfolio management concepts including modern portfolio theory, asset allocation, portfolio construction, manager selection, risk management and performance attribution
+ High degree of computer proficiency is required, specifically the use of Excel and the ability to manage investment models and databases. Experience with Morningstar, Bloomberg, PFaroe DB, @Risk, R programming or Aladdin is a plus
+ Must be detail oriented and able to work independently in a fast-paced, deadline oriented, multi-task environment
+ Strong organizational and project management skills

title: Grants Manager
description:
**Position Description**

The Count Basie Center for the Arts, in the ever-growing and beautiful downtown Red Bank, New Jersey, is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Grants Manager to support the organization’s funding goals.

**Organizational Background**

Founded in 1926, The Count Basie Center for the Arts is New Jersey’s premier center for the cultural arts and its commitment to being a diverse, equitable and inclusive (DEI) performing arts organization is at the core of our mission to Inspire, Educate and Entertain.

As part of that commitment, the Count Basie Center has established a staff DEI task force as well as a board DEI committee. Our purpose is to intentionally embrace and amplify positive change toward diversity, equity, inclusion and accessibility in every area of our organization, including programming, education, staffing, board recruitment, and community engagement.

The Count Basie Center is determined to provide an inclusive environment in which all who walk through our doors can do so as their most authentic selves. We firmly believe that everyone of all backgrounds and identities deserves access to experience the enrichment that the arts contribute to a full life.

**Job Description**

Reporting to the Senior Director of Development, the Grants Manager is an effective storyteller who can bring our arts, education, operations and DEI work to life through strong writing that inspires potential partners’ investment of financial resources. They will be a creative writer who is passionate about the arts, who leverages their project management skills and maintains, deepens, and renews existing Count Basie Center relationships. They will conduct independent outreach via targeted prospecting to build a robust pipeline of grant support.

**Key responsibilities are as follows:**

* Target opportunities that meet Development department goals and fundraising strategies, i.e. arts education programs and Basie Center partnerships.
* Develop a comprehensive understanding of all Count Basie Center departments, projects, programs and priorities by attending classes, performances, special events and meetings with partners.
* Work with Basie Center leadership to create outlines for proposals and facilitate the development of project budgets.
* Draft and review grant proposals/applications and grant required reports (pre and post funding) for funders, tailored to fit specific program areas and interests of the funders, in a timely manner.
* Coordinate and monitor the full grant cycle, with department leadership, to ensure program compliance with grantor guidelines.
* Develop and maintain an ongoing pipeline of potential grant and foundation funders to identify funding opportunities and cultivate donor relationships by having significant interaction with grantors before, during and after the grant process.
* Monitor state and federal legislation that may affect availability of grant funds.
* Attend trainings and conferences about new or existing funding opportunities and professional development.
* The Department’s Development Assistant will support the Grants Manager with grant-related administrative tasks, i.e. maintaining a grants calendar, grant tracking and reporting, updating the donor database, etc.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* As part of the Development team, be available to attend events in the evenings and weekends as needed.

**Qualifications**

* Minimum of three (3) years of experience in grant writing, technical writing, proof-reading, editing, copy writing, or equivalent written communication format.
* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent non-traditional educational experience.
* Excellent written and oral communication skills.
* Knowledge of grant funding policies and procedures and applicable local, state and federal funding opportunities and requirements.
* Highly organized with the ability to implement systems and follow-up processes.
* Motivated self-starter with the ability to work collaboratively and independently with purpose and accuracy in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to work effectively under pressure.
* Eagerness to learn new things and able to adapt to constantly changing circumstances.
* Strong research skills – ability to identify and research grant & foundation prospects.
* Experience with a donor database preferred, such as Raiser’s Edge and Instrumentl.

This is a full-time, exempt position and eligible for The Basie’s competitive benefits package that includes paid time off (personal, sick and vacation), insurance (health, dental, vision, life, long and short-term disability) and a 401(k)-retirement plan including company match. This position operates on a hybrid schedule that allows for remote work 2 days a week. The annual salary range is $50,000-$62,000 commensurate with experience.

Interested candidates should apply on The Basie website at https://thebasie.org/jobs/.Applicants please include a recent grant proposal.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $62,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Grant writing: 3 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Red Bank, NJ 07701 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Red Bank, NJ 07701

title: New York State Pre-K Assistant Teacher, Tutor Time of East Rockaway
description:
Join a strong community where all we do is care-for the children and families we serve every day, as well as for our dedicated team members. Our people are our best asset. We listen and we know what you're looking for:

* You want benefits. We support you with a minimum 50% childcare discount, immediate access to benefits, innovative health programs, 401(k) company match, and much more.
* You want balance. We offer flexible schedules that work for you, no nights or weekends, the ability to bring your children to work with you, and paid time off.
* You want opportunity. We invest in your future with ongoing training, tuition reimbursement, credential assistance, and our unique Master Teacher Program.
* You want recognition. We provide a positive, fun workplace where employees are appreciated.



The State Pre-K Assistant Teacher is responsible for instructing 4-year old's, based on needs of each child, and the requirements of the program. We want change makers who never stop being curious, inventive, and open-hearted to prepare children for Kindergarten and beyond.


As an Assistant Teacher, you are:


* **Caring!** Follow all licensing guidelines, company standards and grant program requirements to ensure the daily care of every child in your classroom.
* **Engaged!** Develop your ability to accurately observe, assess, and plan for children, as well as effectively communicate with families.
* **Knowledgeable!** Complete extensive training that provides insight on child care, preschool and development topics.
* **Creative!** Implement curriculum while creating fun, interactive learning experiences for the children.

We want energetic, dependable, passionate individuals who have:


* Associates in Early Childhood Education, Child Development or related or an active CDA in Preschool is preferred
* High School Diploma and Six hours of college credit in Early Childhood Education or Related field required.
* Experience in a licensed childcare center or related field.
* The ability to meet state requirements for education and our center requirements.
* Able to work indoors or outdoors and engage in physical activity with children.

Compensation & Benefits:
* Pay $16.50 - $18.00 hourly, Bi-weekly and Daily Pay options; based on Position, Education and Experience
* Immediate Health insurance (medical, dental and vision), paid time-off and 401K (plus company match) provided for full-time employees.
* Limited medical offered for part-time workers.
* Education assistance including tuition reimbursement and certification available to all employees
* Monday-Friday work week

  


Learning Care Group is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against an employee or applicant based on race, color, religion, national origin or ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status or any other protected status under federal, state, or local law.

title: Vice President, Financial Crimes Risk Quality Control Lead
description:
Vice President, Financial Crimes Risk Quality Control Lead

Job Number:

 3258365


POSTING DATE: Sep 3, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-Purchase
EDUCATION LEVEL: Bachelor's Degree
JOB: Wealth Management
EMPLOYMENT TYPE: Full Time
JOB LEVEL: Vice President

DESCRIPTION


Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm's employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.  

  

As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  

  

The WM and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk Team is embedded within the Firm's business line. It is responsible for identifying, assessing, and escalating potential money laundering and reputational risk issues associated with higher risk client types. The WM and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk Team is considered the first line of defense and supports the onboarding, enhanced due diligence, and negative news processes for Morgan Stanley.  

  

Primary Responsibilities  

* Review QC findings prepared by the QC Analyst/Manager and focus on analysis of associated risk factors, including any factors that increase or mitigate the risk posed by the error documented
* Assist in preparing ongoing and ad hoc reporting for senior management.
* Escalate potential risk issues associated with new and existing account customer profiles with internal management and the Second Line of Defense Bank AML Compliance teams.
* Contribute to the planning and performance of internal reviews of controls residing within various product and business areas to ensure that controls are adequately designed and are operating effectively.
* Assist in maintaining and updating procedures and proposing testing methods or alternative recommendations for process improvements and program efficiency.

#LI-AJ1
QUALIFICATIONS


Experience Required:  

* Minimum undergraduate degree in related field or an equivalent combination of training and experience
* Minimum 7 years of experience in financial crimes/AML compliance testing, Audit or similar related QA/QC testing experience at a financial institution

  

Skills Required:  

- Expert knowledge of AML regulatory requirements and expectations (Domestic - US and International - non-US), MS WM and U.S. Banks Financial Crimes Risk policies and procedures, KYC standards, and QC Program  

* Strong communications, analytical, organizational, project management and planning skills to be able to develop QC Testing Program, test scripts, testing reports and metrics reporting and manage testing analysts
* Strong managerial experience leading teams of 6-10 people
* Strong knowledge of business, products, operations, systems and organization to be able to execute the QC Program
* Basic knowledge of MS Office (Microsoft Excel/PowerPoint/Word/Access)
* Experience with data and trend analysis related to the management of an AML program
* Experience in AML/CFT and/or Legal/Regulatory Compliance

  

Ability to:  

* Take initiative, analyze, summarize, and communicate effectively
* Investigate, identify issues, impacts and trends as a result of QC testing to propose comprehensive solutions for the business unit and/or organization
* Multitask effectively and action matters promptly
* Work independently and in a team environment
* Handle highly confidential information with appropriate discretion.
* Work in a high volume, fast paced environment
* Work in a matrixed organization, leveraging resources across the organization to perform QC activity and effect change based on QC findings

  

Additional Skills Desired:  

Certified as an Anti-Money Laundering Specialist by ACAMS or equivalent AML certification/license/audit/control testing certification (is a plus)  

  

Morgan Stanley's goal is to build and maintain a workforce that is diverse in experience and background but uniform in reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Consequently, our recruiting efforts reflect our desire to attract and retain the best and brightest from all talent pools. We want to be the first choice for prospective employees.  

  

It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, sex stereotype, gender, gender identity or expression, transgender, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy, veteran or military service status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

  

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce (M/F/Disability/Vet).  

  

Expected base pay rates for the role will be between $110,000 and $185,000 per year at the commencement of employment. However, base pay if hired will be determined on an individualized basis and is only part of the total compensation package, which, depending on the position, may also include commission earnings, incentive compensation, discretionary bonuses, other short and long-term incentive packages, and other Morgan Stanley sponsored benefit programs.

**About Abbott House**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Job Description**

Abbott House is seeking compassionate Child Care Workers to implement, monitor and evaluate the Youth’s service plans. As a Child Care Worker, you will provide the youngster individual and group services and will ensure that the day-to-day routines of the youth are maintained. * Ensure that children are provided with a clean and safe environment.
* Attend parent-teacher conferences and other school activities.
* Inform Residence Manager of any problem affecting the functioning of the residence.
* Manage the transportation of children to and from approved destinations.
* Manage the purchase and preparation of food.
* Evaluate the clothing needs of children and the purchasing of these items.

You are the ideal candidate if you enjoy working in the social services field while empowering underserved communities. Being compassionate, reliable, self-motivated, and a team player are critical attributes to being successful in this role.

description:
$5,000.00 Sign on Bonus for Full Time

$50.00 per hour

Greenwich Woods Rehabilitation and Health Care Center in Greenwich, Connecticut is seeking experienced Registered Nurses to join our Team!

Full Time Part-Time and Per Diem Registered

RN Charge Nurses for all shifts:

7:00 AM to 3:00 PM; 3:00 PM to 11:00 PM; 11:00 PM to 7:00 AM

We offer Competitive wages and an excellent benefit package which includes:

· Medical And Dental Insurance

· Paid time off

· 401 k

· Company paid Life Insurance

· Premium pay on holidays

· Paid Holidays

Greenwich Woods is a 217-bed long term/short term rehabilitation facility that has been serving the Westchester and Fairfield Counties for more than 30 years. Our facility is conveniently located on the border of Rye Brook NY, with easy access to the Hutchinson/Merritt Parkways and I684.

Registered Nurses must have strong clinical skills, and previous experience in long term care preferred. Attention to detail, a positive attitude, good follow through skills and the ability to manage multiple tasks are required. RN must work as a team, this critical to providing excellent clinical care.

Registered Nurses must demonstrate a willingness to assist others and work as a team member.

**RN Charge Nurse Responsibilities**

* Registered Nurses are accountable for the medical care and well-being of the patients, including med-pass, treatments, order transcriptions, and thorough documentation.
* Registered Nurses coordinate, direct and oversee the delivery of care by ancillary staff.
* Registered Nurses demonstrate competence in clinical skills as well as electronic medical records.
* Registered Nurses collaborate with physicians and other health care professionals; comply with orders in a timely manner.
* RN’s conduct unit rounds, ensuring that clinical practices are delivered within the facility's established standards of care.
* Registered Nurses maintain standards of care in accordance with regulatory agencies.

**RNCharge Nurse Qualifications**

* Current State of Connecticut RN License
* Registered Nurses must have excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* RN’s must have the ability to work as part of a team, while managing multiple tasks in a safe and effective manner.
* Registered Nurses must be courteous and professional with an exceptional "bedside manner."
* RN’s must have a high tolerance for working under pressure and handling critical situations

We value our employees and support job enthusiasm and positive relationships.

Greenwich Woods is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all qualified applicants, regardless of age, ancestry, color, disability, gender, gender identity, marital status, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation or veteran status.

Looking to combine work, fitness and fun? Working at Crunch is more than a job, it’s an opportunity to inspire others to reach their fitness goals. Our ‘No Judgments’ philosophy attracts a diverse and welcoming group of professionals and makes Crunch an amazing company to work for.  

  

We are looking for energetic persons who want to work at a fun, high paced gym. If you are that person, then Crunch wants you!

title: Personal Banker
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Responsible for providing exceptional customer service in accordance with Valley's mission statement. Ability to engage customers with friendly and professional service.
* Knowledge of all Bank products and services and ability to educate and demonstrate customers on such, as well as cross sell various products and services.
* Ability to present a confident and professional demeanor to establish trust and gain knowledge from the customer. Analyze needs and recommend appropriate products and services.
* Meets with customers to analyze financial needs and maximize sales opportunities. Offers all bank products and assists with other service needs, opens new accounts, i.e., checking, savings, certificate of deposit and IRAs, discusses/sells loan products to existing and prospective customers and possesses knowledge of on-line banking and mobile banking abilities to promote and demonstrate to customers.
* Responsible for meeting customer expectations and achieving service quality standards. Participates/oversees the sales referral process ensuring customer financial needs are met and assists management in coaching and mentoring branch staff members.
* Ability to perform all transactions required by a customer and use appropriate technology to provide services most effectively and efficiently. Maintain and balance a cash box. Ability to utilize technology such as Teller Scanning Equipment, Cash Recycling and Cash Dispensing machines and support customers in the use of Coin Machines.
* Act as Vault Teller ensuring adequacy of Branch cash for daily transactions by assisting the branch staff in ordering and shipping currency - coin and controlling - distributing cash to Tellers in prescribed limits.
* Assists in community events (i.e., Habitat for Humanity) etc. Participates in and supports CRA initiatives, activities and programs.
* Report all significant matters, issues and unusual customer activity to Manager maintaining personal knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements.
* Maintains knowledge and compliance with the Bank's Code of Conduct and all policies and procedures.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication. Ability to write correspondence and appropriately and accurately demonstrate products and services to customers.
* Excellent interpersonal - customer service skills, attentiveness, information retention, tact and diplomacy in dealing with both customers and employees.
* Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills to effectively uncover and resolve complex customer issues.
* Ability to make sound decisions which include making on-the-spot decisions regarding customer transactions; weighing customer satisfaction issues with the Bank exposure to loss or fraud and the ability to think through and rationalize decisions.
* Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or scheduled form.
* Provides deep understanding of Retail Banking and strong Customer Service Skills with the ability to engage customers in conversation regarding products and services.
* Detail oriented, strong organizational skills, and high degree of accuracy.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Proficient computer skills.

**Required Experience:**
* High School diploma or GED and minimum 1 year of business services experience in branch banking and knowledge of branch operations or successful completion of a Valley Retail training program.
* Associates or Bachelor's degree with concentration in accounting, business, finance, economics or a related field is preferred.

**Preferred Experience:**
* FIS/IBS (Integrated Banking Solutions).
company_description: If you think working in banking can’t be exciting, think again. The financial industry is undergoing a digital transformation, which makes this a great time to embark on a career at Valley.

title: Project Coordinator
description:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
* Understand the business goals of the project to ensure stakeholder/sponsor expectations are met.
* Maintain, monitor and update project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets and expenditures.
* Communicate status, changes, and critical issues throughout the project to key project stakeholders and sponsors.
* Ensure that all team members understand the scope of the project as well as what they are individually responsible to complete.
* Organize, attend and participate in project meetings.
* Document and follow up on important actions and decisions from meetings.
* Prepare necessary presentation materials for meetings.
* Ensure project deadlines are met.
* Determine project changes and update associated documentation.
* Provide administrative support as needed.
* Undertake project tasks as required.
* Implement project management methodologies and standards.
* Assist with project risks and issue assessment, coordinate the development of mitigation/resolution plans, where applicable.
* Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.
* Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute updated project documentation to all project team members.
* Ensure project standards, guidelines, and processes are applied and maintained across all technology projects.

Requirements:
**Required Skills:*** Must possess excellent time management, multitasking, and stress management skills. Ability to work on tight deadlines.
* Ability to adjust to multiple demands and constituencies by shifting priorities; and through rapid change and flexibility.
* Ability to motivate and influence others to stay on task and schedule.
* Excellent communication skills both written and oral.
* Displays good judgement as it relates to issue and risk escalation.
* Advanced user MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Project.
* Effectively establish and maintain good working relationships with all levels of management internal/external to project office.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team. Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.

**Required Experience:*** High School Diploma or GED and a minimum of 1 year project coordination or project management support experience OR Bachelor's degree in related field and completion of relevant internship experience.
* Demonstrated experience working within cross-functional teams within a formalized methodology.
* IT background within the Banking industry preferred.
* Lean Certificate or Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) preferred.

title: Android Developer
description:
**About us**

CYASOON Corporation is a small business in New York, NY. We are professional, agile, professional and our goal is to bring back the joy of spontaneity. Cyasoon is the easiest way to go out and make new friends, right NOW, and we want you to enjoy working by, with, and through us to not only achieve your personal, professional, and financial and professional goals, but to also make a difference in this world.

Our work environment includes:

* Modern office setting
* Food provided
* Modern office setting
* Growth opportunities
* Work-from-home days

Hey there,

Feeling like the world is missing a bit of human connection? We feel it too. That's where Cyasoon comes in. It's our mission to create meaningful connections and bring people together.

I'm Ketan Chand, and I want to share with you our project, Cyasoon. It's a fun, safe, and efficient way to meet new people. We strip away the fluff of profiles and pictures and get down to the real stuff — you. We empower you to make a quick video pitch and let our innovative AI do the rest. It's about real, human interaction at your fingertips.

Cyasoon is here for all aspects of your life — be it work or play. We started this journey with just an idea in 2020 and since 2023, we've been building INSANE momentum. Now, we're excited to invite you to join us in this adventure.

Why should you join us? Here's why:

Be part of a small, high-powered founding team. Grow alongside us, and stand a chance to secure a significant equity share. Be part of a company that values diversity, creativity, and humanity. We operate out of SoHo, New York City, and we're all about in-person interaction. Plus, we offer a healthy, spacious work environment with lots of natural light.

As for the role, it's intense but rewarding. You can expect a 90-100 hour work week, with time for essential rest and exercise. And yes, we're talking about weekend work and pushing through holidays. But it's all to make a difference in people's lives.

We're looking for an Android Software Engineer to work with our team. Here's what you'll do:

Develop and implement Cyasoon's core logic. Launch new Android app features into our core product. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver product features on time. Keep up-to-date with Android trends and technologies.

And here's what you bring to the table:

Software engineering expertise, from design to deployment. Commitment to creating the best user experience. Holistic problem-solving skills. Ability to lead with empathy. Business-minded focus.

We would love it if you: Have experience building Android products. Have skills in our tech stack: Swift/Kotlin/TypeScript, Node.js, and MongoDB. Can balance business priorities with team strengths and career goals. Know about pioneers like Ada Lovelace, Douglas Engelbart, Alan Kay. Have interests outside of technology, especially with PARTYING and SPORTS and even GLAMOUR MODELING. In return, you'll make history as the engineer who revolutionized the way people interact and come together. We see you as a part of our family, contributing to a solution to one of today's greatest challenges. And as a bonus, say goodbye to money worries.

We welcome people from all walks of life to apply. If you have the passion and share our values, we'd love to hear from you. At Cyasoon, we uphold equal opportunities and make hiring decisions based on merit, not bias. We also provide reasonable accommodation for those who need it.

The base pay rate for this role in New York is $55 - $60 per hour, based on factors like your expertise. And based on your performance, cultural fit and devotion to the cause, Cyasoon also may also offer you a significant stake in the company!

So are you ready to take on this exciting challenge with us? If so, let's hear from you.

Cyasoon,  
Ketan Chand

title: Director of Manufacturing & Production
description:
**Position Overview:**

This role offers a strategic opportunity for a seasoned professional to drive innovation and operational excellence in food production within a hospital setting. The ideal candidate will have a solid manufacturing background, a passion for food production, and expertise in facilities management, finance, and client service.

**Key Requirements:**

* **Manufacturing Experience:** Must have experience in large-scale food manufacturing and production, ideally within a healthcare or institutional setting.
* **Quality Leadership:** Proven leadership in ensuring high standards and regulatory compliance (FDA, USDA).
* **Finance:** Strong financial acumen for budgeting, resource allocation, and cost-saving measures.
* **Union Management:** Experience in navigating union dynamics and maintaining positive labor relations.
* **Facilities Management:** Expertise in managing kitchen facilities, equipment, and workflow to optimize efficiency and safety.
* **Client Service:** Exceptional skills in client interaction, addressing concerns, and planning for future expansions.

**Responsibilities:**

* Manage food production for 14+ hospital facilities, ensuring high-quality, timely delivery.
* Collaborate with culinary teams to execute consistent menu offerings.
* **Facilities Management:**
* Oversee kitchen facilities, equipment, and storage.
* Coordinate maintenance and optimize facility layout for efficiency.
* **Client Interaction:**

* **Financial Management:**
* Oversee budgeting and financial transactions, ensuring transparency and cost efficiency.
* **Union Employee Management:**
* Foster positive labor relations and manage grievances in compliance with collective bargaining agreements.

**Qualifications:**

* **Education:** Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.
* **Experience:** Demonstrated experience in food manufacturing, facilities management, client service, and working with unionized labor.
* **Skills:** Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.

This role is critical for enhancing the culinary center's growth and operational success, requiring a blend of manufacturing expertise, financial insight, and leadership capabilities.

title: Accountant I_092024
description:
***While*** ***CSBM/FOREsight is headquartered in New York City, this position is full-time remote.*** CSBM currently operates in AZ, CO, DE, FL, ID, IL, KS, MD, NC, NJ, NY, PA, SC, TX, UT, and VA.

 **Why Join Us:**

  

We believe our team members are our greatest company asset and value them as such! Our staff are all strong team players who thrive in an entrepreneurial environment.

 **CSBM:** Charter School Business Management believes every child deserves a quality education. Recognizing the potential of the charter school movement to remedy our country’s educational inequalities, we are dedicated to empowering the charter sector with financial education, services, and resources. Our clients work tirelessly to provide great opportunities for the students they serve, and we are committed to helping them succeed!

 **Your Job:**



The Accountant will be assigned to work with a variety of clients from both charter schools and non-profit organizations. The role serves as an accountant for our clients and requires strong communication skills, task management skills, and being organized and team-oriented. The Accountant performs day-to-day tasks for multiple clients and maintains their financial data.

  

Although the scope of work is different for every client, the Accountant will be responsible for performing **Accounting** **and** **Consulting activities** as well as other tasks and duties outlined below.

  


**Your Duties:**

 **1) Accounting**


*Accounts Payable*

* Review and reconcile accounts payable tasks.
* Process bank and credit card reconciliation.
* Research and reconcile financial discrepancies with clients and vendors.


*Payroll*


* Process payroll in the client payroll platform and enter it into the accounting system.


*Monthly Close*


* Prepare the books monthly, quarterly, and annual close
* Prepare payments by verifying documentation and requesting disbursement.
* Review financial transactions and maintain documentation
* Manage and track expenses related to all contracts and grants.
* Prepares 1099s
* Recommend financial actions by analyzing accounting options.
* Provide financial information and assist with preparing reports.


*Audit*


* Complete audit schedules.

  


**2) Client Consulting**


* Manage multiple clients simultaneously in a remote environment.
* Execute multiple client deliverables and priorities.

  


**3) Task Management**


* Manage Accounts Payable Specialist task assignments including payroll, accounts payable, and bank reconciliation.
* Conduct on-the-job training for new team members.
* Maintain accurate records of work hours and time spent on given projects.

 **You Should Know:**

  

* Microsoft Office 365


* Proficient in Excel.


* Bill.com, Any bill.


* QuickBooks, Intacct, FundEZ, or similar accounting software.


* Payroll Management Software (ADP, Paychex, or similar).
  


**Your Education & Experience:**

  

* Bachelor’s degree required.


* 5+ years of accounting and bookkeeping experience.


* 3+ years of full-cycle accounting experience (simultaneous activities of AP/AR, payroll, month-end close)


* Prior experience as a consultant working with multiple clients and projects is a plus.


* Prior experience working in a non-profit, school, or socially responsible organization is a plus.
  


**Your Competencies / Skills:**

  

These competencies are specific to the Financial Consultant role and need to be demonstrated to achieve performance goals.


* + **Consulting -** Proactively develops a rapport with clients to understand needs and find ways to ensure client satisfaction.
	+ **Task Management –** Prioritize competing deadlines to execute client deliverables and meet self-established goals, as well as team or leadership priorities.
	+ **Attention to Detail** - Is thorough when performing work and conscientious about attending to detail and keeping accurate records, completing work according to procedures and standards.
	+ **Delegation** - Assign tasks, responsibilities, and accountability to the right team members taking their skills, experience, and capabilities into account. Set clear and reasonable expectations, hold the team members accountable, and follow up on the execution of work.
	+ **Confidentiality –** Maintain the privacy of sensitive organizational, employee, and client information.

  

  



**Getting In:**

  

* We encourage people of all backgrounds to apply.
  


**The Perks:**

  

* Health, Dental, and Vision.


* Flexible spending accounts – Medical and Transit.


* Discretionary Annual Bonus.


* 401k Match.
  



CSBM is an equal-opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws.

title: RN (Ambulatory Clinic) - 5X8- No Weekends + $5,000 SOB - Manhattan
description:
Base Salary + Sign On Bonus (SOB)

AdvantageCare Physicians (ACPNY) is a primary and specialty care practice serving half a million patients across the New York metropolitan area. With more than 35 medical offices across New York City and Long Island, ACPNY is continually expanding our practice and enhancing our services for communities throughout New York. As we grow, our employees grow with us.

**The ideal candidate should have**

· Work experience as a Nurse in a hospital or ambulatory setting

· Patient-centered approach toward a positive patient experience

· Excellent communication skills

· Interest in Population Health

**Responsibilities**

* Participates and supports the health team in direct patient care. Performs duties involving direct patient care as assigned by the physician within the framework of the New York State Nurse Practice Act and AdvantageCare Physicians' policies and procedures.
* Identifies physical, behavioral, and emotional characteristics typical for the age group of the patient receiving care. Modifies approaches based on patient age-specific needs and responses to treatment.
* Triages and assesses patients according to nursing process, by telephone and in person and documents appropriately in patients Electronic Health Record (EHR).
* Demonstrates excellent clinical skills. Is a role model and resource for the clinical staff.
* Prioritizes patient care by implementing physician orders and nursing process. Acts as a patient advocate and upholds patient rights.
* Acts rapidly and calmly during emergencies, initiates cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and provides the necessary items called for by the team.
* Prepares the patients for physical examination, chaperones the patient during examination, as needed.
* Appropriately adheres to universal safety precautions when administering medications and disposal of medical waste.
* Demonstrates a professional, courteous, welcoming, tactful, patient, and respectful attitude in dealing with patients, families and significant others, at all times. Proactively seeks to minimize any patient concerns/issues by addressing immediately or by referring to appropriate administrative team member.
* Demonstrates proficiency with computer systems (e.g., electronic practice management/electronic health record) within 3 months of training. Completes all tasks on the electronic system that are required for the job function consistently, accurately, and in a timely manner.
* Ensures that all patients receive personalized, prompt attention and are treated with receptiveness, dignity and respect.
* Recognizes and performs duties which need to be performed although not directly assigned. All other duties as assigned.
* Demonstrates good judgment, discretion and ability to problem solve. Monitors completion of all tasks assigned to LPN/CTA II and CTA I
* Attends all meetings as directed by practice administrator/designee.
* Performs other job-related duties as required

**Qualifications**

* Graduate of an accredited school of nursing
* Current, unrestricted, licensure in the State of New York as a Registered Nurse
* Knowledge of professional nursing theory, regulations and practices to give and evaluate patient care
* Knowledge or Electronic Medical Records (EMR)
* Ability to work independently within scope of practice, make appropriate clinical decisions and delegate appropriately
* Basic Life Support (BLS) required

**Medical Office Hours of Operation**

· Monday-Thursday 8:00AM – 6:00PM

· Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**Why work at AdvantageCare Physicians?**

ACPNY’s vision is to become a home for health that provides personal, effective, and convenient care for the neighborhoods and communities we serve. When our teams of providers, nurses, and specialists work together, we can get patients in sooner, answer their questions in real time, and give them the support they need to achieve their health goals. Everything we do is guided by our values:

Empower — We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.

Deliver — We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.

Do It Together — We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Encouraging growth and development is an important part of the employee experience at ACPNY. We empower employees to develop both personally and professionally through a variety of programs, including internal collaborative learning opportunities where team members share stories from their own lives, discuss research, and ultimately learn from each other.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to creating a strong workplace and community.

title: Psychologist
company: Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Wellness Center
description:
\\*\\*Job Opening: Child Psychologist\\*\\*

Merrick, NY

Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Wellness Center

Part Time Child Psychologist- Flexible

At Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Wellness Center, we are dedicated to providing compassionate, evidence-based psychological services to children and their families. Our private practice is known for creating a warm, welcoming environment where children feel supported and understood. We pride ourselves on our commitment to excellence and are looking to expand our team with a skilled and empathetic Child Psychologist.

We are seeking a licensed and experienced Child Psychologist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about working with children and adolescents, providing high-quality therapeutic services, and collaborating with parents and caregivers to promote positive outcomes. We seek to make this an ideal job by providing a caseload based on individual preferences for age rage, clinical specialty, and availability of hours.

Key Responsibilities:

- Provide individual and family therapy to address a range of psychological issues, including anxiety, depression, behavioral disorders, and trauma.

- Develop and implement treatment plans tailored to each child’s unique needs.

- Collaborate with parents, teachers, and other professionals to support the child’s development and well-being.

- Stay up-to-date with the latest research and best practices in child psychology.

- Maintain accurate and confidential client records in accordance with ethical and legal standards.

Qualifications

- Doctoral degree in Clinical Psychology, Counseling Psychology, or a related field (Ph.D. or Psy.D.).

- Current licensure as a Psychologist in New York or License Eligible. (Open to Post Docs

- Demonstrated expertise in providing evidence-based therapy.

- Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build rapport with children and their families.

Preferred Qualifications

- Specialized training or certification in child and adolescent therapy (e.g., play therapy, cognitive-behavioral therapy).

- Experience working with diverse populations and understanding cultural and contextual factors.

- Familiarity with school systems and educational psychology.

What We Offer

- Competitive salary and benefits package (Simple IRA), Malpractice Insurance

- Flexible work schedule with options for part-time or full-time positions.

- Supportive and collegial work environment.

- Access to a range of therapeutic resources and tools.

-Provide administrative and billing support

- Ongoing direct and peer supervision

\\*\\*How to Apply:\\*\\*

Interested candidates should submit the following application materials:

- A cover letter outlining your experience and interest in the position.

- A current resume or CV.

- Contact information for three professional references.

Please send your application to [email address] with the subject line “Child Psychologist Application - [Your Name].” For inquiries about the position, contact [Contact Person] at [Phone Number] or [Email Address].

Cognitive Behavior Therapy and Wellness Center is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Prep Chef
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Chef to join our esteemed team. The successful candidate will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of food preparation and service in our fine dining restaurant, ensuring exceptional quality and consistency in every dish. The ideal candidate will have a passion for hospitality and a proven track record of managing a busy kitchen with ease.

Duties:

- Manage the day-to-day operations of the kitchen, including menu planning, inventory management, and staff supervision.  
- Prepare and cook a wide variety of dishes, from appetizers to entrees, ensuring that all food meets the highest standards of quality and presentation.  
- Oversee the dietary department, ensuring that all special requests and dietary restrictions are accommodated.  
- Collaborate with the restaurant management team to create new menu items and develop seasonal specials.  
- Train and supervise kitchen staff, providing guidance and support to help them improve their skills.  
- Ensure that all food safety and sanitation regulations are adhered to at all times.  
- Maintain a clean and organized kitchen environment, ensuring that all equipment and tools are in good working order.  
- Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring that all guests have a memorable dining experience.

Experience:

- Proven experience in a restaurant management role, with a focus on food service management and supervising kitchen staff.  
- Experience in a fine dining restaurant environment is highly desirable.  
- Strong background in food preparation and culinary skills.  
- Experience with dietary department and accommodating special requests and dietary restrictions.  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks at once.  
- Excellent communication and leadership skills.

Skills:

- Experience in a restaurant environment.  
- Strong food service management skills.  
- Proven ability to supervise and train kitchen staff.  
- Knowledge of food preparation and presentation techniques.  
- Experience in a fine dining restaurant environment.  
- Ability to help with dietary department and accommodate special requests and dietary restrictions.  
- Experience in a culinary role with a focus on food preparation.  
- Experience with hospitality and customer service.

title: Community Administrator
description:
Come work at Associa! We are an industry leader in community association management and we are looking for a talented part time administrative assistant to join our team. If you're serious about your next move, Associa is an excellent place to grow your career.
**Part Time, 20 hours per week. Monday and Wednesday 6 hours and Thursday full day.**An Administrative Assistant is responsible providing clerical and administrative support to the lead Community Manager(s). The Administrative Assistant is the liaison to the lead Community Manager(s) and homeowners primarily, but will also occasionally interact with vendors, board members and committee members, as well as staff at the Associa Client Shared  

Service Center (CSSC) and within the branch office.

Duties include but are not limited to


* Field and respond promptly to the majority of homeowner inquiries via phone, e-mail, work order, letter, and/or in person.
* Interact with vendors and assist with addressing emergency requests as necessary
* Update notes within homeowner accounts in C3 (Complete Control of Communities) of all conversations/correspondence with homeowner.
* Assist in preparing agendas, update management reports, and compile documents and copies for Board meeting packages.
* Prepare newsletters, flyers, and other various documents to inform homeowners of maintenance service or projects, activities, meetings, etc.
* Assist in preparing annual disclosure packages, annual meeting notifications, and annual financial statement packages for all homeowners and arrange bulk mailing of same within the time frames set by state statute or governing documents.
* Assist lead Community Manager in monitoring corporate and client delinquency rates and collections process for account portfolio.
* Maintain property files and unit files.
* Assist lead Community Manager with processing new homeowner welcome packets, if applicable.
* Assist lead Community Manager with issuing of key fobs, pool passes and processing access keys.
* Assist lead Community Manager with ARB (Architectural Review Board) application processing and perform on-site community inspections as necessary.
* Assist lead Community Manager with requests for proposals, repair quotes, insurance notification lists.
* Assist lead Community Manager with update of property fact sheets in C3.
* Assist lead Community Manager in preparing homeowner CC&R violation letter and communicate results of hearings to homeowners within the time frames set by state statues or governing documents as needed.
* Assist homeowners with Associa corporate programs (website, portals, etc.) in accordance with lead Community Manager direction, client enrollment, and local office protocol.
* Participate in Associa training including Associa University webinars, etc.
* While the list above is an extensive list of job responsibilities, it is expected that the individual in this position is hands on and flexible in performing, assisting, and/or supervising any necessary task that is requested by our client and/or the management agent.
* Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:
Requirements:


* Knowledge of Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) at a proficient level.
* Knowledge of communities/property/real estate and homeowners associations.
* Knowledge of the role of the association board, the Community Association Manager, and how  

those roles interface with the requests of homeowners.
* Knowledge of typical business correspondence (grammar, structure, punctuation, spelling, etc.)  

at a proficient level.
* Knowledge of conflict resolution techniques at a proficient level.
* Professional communication skills (phone, interpersonal, written, verbal, etc.).
* Professional customer service skills.
* Self-motivated, proactive, detail oriented and a team player.
* Time management and time critical prioritization skills.
* High School Diploma or GED Required

title: Community Association Manager
description:
Associa is currently looking for a Community Association Manager (CAM) to join our team in Monroe and Holmdel, NJ. As a Community Association Manager, you will work closely with our clients and vendors, and partner with other Associa departments. To be successful in this role you will need great customer service skills and the ability to work on multiple projects.



What do we offer?



Associa offers a competitive benefits package to our full-time employees including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401k, disability insurance, and support with wellness and development initiatives and more. We have been designated Great Place to Work for six consecutive years and many of our locations are awarded as Best and Brightest.



How will you make an impact?



The Community Association Manager (CAM) helps the company grow by:


* Acting as or overseeing the primary liaison with the Association Board of Directors and homeowners as needed.
* Traveling to client associations to attend board meetings, perform inspections, conduct walk-throughs, and attend community events as needed and per the management agreement.
* Preparing annual disclosure packages, annual meeting notifications, and annual financial statement packages for all homeowners and arrange bulk mailing of same within the time frames set by state or governing documents.
* Reviewing monthly financial reports and ensuring management summary is submitted to the association Board of Directors.
* Providing and/or overseeing recommendations to the Association Board of Directors and committees regarding major capital expenditures as required to maintain the desired community appearance and operation.

Requirements:
Requirements:


* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (word, excel, outlook)
* Experience in Community Management, customer service, hospitality or other related industry.
* Proficiency in typical business correspondence (grammar, structure, punctuation, spelling, etc.).
* Proficient in Customer Service and conflict resolution
* Able to work effectively with others in person and in group setting
* Able to prioritize, manage time, and meet deadlines.
* Able to communicate effectively and professionally on phone, email, and in-person
