title: Pop Up Brand Ambassador
description:
**Job Title: Pop-Up Ambassador**

**Location:** New Jersey (Travel to various local gyms required)

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**About KIMITH:**KIMITH is more than just a luxury athleisure wear brand; we are a movement dedicated to promoting heart-healthy living in style. We encourage everyone to "Build Your Beat" by strengthening their heartbeat and presence in the world. We are seeking a dynamic, driven individual to join our team as a Pop-Up Ambassador, helping to bring our brand’s vision to life in local communities.

**Position Overview:**As a KIMITH Pop-Up Ambassador, you will be the face of our brand at local gyms and fitness centers. Your primary responsibilities will include setting up and managing pop-up shops, engaging with potential customers, and driving sales. You will play a key role in expanding our brand’s reach and fostering a community around our heart-healthy lifestyle ethos.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Pop-Up Setup and Management:** Travel to various local gyms and fitness centers to set up pop-up shops. This includes transporting and setting up clothing racks, displaying merchandise attractively, and ensuring the pop-up space aligns with KIMITH’s brand aesthetic.
* **Sales and Customer Engagement:** Actively engage with gym-goers, educate them about KIMITH's mission and products, and drive sales through effective communication and relationship-building. Utilize your public speaking skills to present the brand confidently.
* **Entrepreneurial Mindset:** Take ownership of the pop-up shops, identifying opportunities to improve sales performance, enhance customer experience, and expand brand presence. Be proactive in suggesting new ideas and approaches to achieve sales goals.
* **Merchandise Management:** Store and manage merchandise inventory when not in use. Ensure that products are kept in pristine condition and that inventory levels are monitored and maintained.
* **Brand Representation:** Embody the KIMITH lifestyle by living and promoting a heart-healthy, fitness-oriented lifestyle. Represent the brand’s ethos both in and out of the pop-up shops. Being a fitness instructor is a plus, as it aligns with our brand values.
* **Reliable Transportation:** Ensure that you have reliable transportation to travel to various locations. Punctuality and dependability are essential, as you will be responsible for setting up and managing pop-up shops according to a schedule.
* **Full-Time Availability:** Be available to work full-time at least 4 days a week, including weekends and evenings as needed, to align with gym peak hours and special events.

**Qualifications:**

* Strong public speaking and interpersonal communication skills.
* Proven sales experience with a track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
* Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently and take initiative.
* Experience in retail, event setup, or a similar role is preferred.
* Reliable transportation and willingness to travel locally.

title: Environmental Health and Safety Officer
description:
Environmental Health and Safety Officer

***\\*Reports Directly to Health, Safety and Environmental Manager (“HSE Manager”)***

**Daily Rounds:**

· Conduct multiple daily rounds of the vessel in the dry dock using each day’s “Plan of the Day” as a guideline for priority areas. Specific focus should be dedicated to areas where (1) welding is being performed, (2) tank-related work, and (3) work taking place at a height or where fall protection is required. Note: regardless of the activity noted on the “Plan of the Day,”, all areas of the ship must be surveyed for general hazards and cleanliness issues.

· Conduct at least one daily round in the dry dock itself, and more frequently based on type and quantity of work taking place. The dry dock is to include the pump room and caisson.

· Conduct multiple daily rounds of the south pier and lay down area, including rounds on board any vessel being worked on.

· Conduct multiple daily rounds of the warehouses and facility, paying particular attention to stanchions and chains around the dry dock for possible damage.

· Conduct fire extinguisher inspections once per month. The inspections must be at least 20 days apart (but no more than 40 days apart). Extinguisher inventory to be used to ensure all extinguishers are inspected and signed off on.

· Monitor “Hazmat area” daily for cleanliness and ensure that all containers are properly stored and labeled.

· Perform periodic inspections of equipment as required, including fall arrest equipment, personal floatation devices, lifting equipment (hoists, slings, chains, etc.) and document findings.

· Collaborate with HSE Manager to develop weekly schedule, ensuring safety oversight on weekends and holidays.

**Reporting Duties:**

· Attend daily 0700 Production Meeting.

· Report significant safety concerns to HSE Manager immediately.

· Document all findings each day including corrective action taken to mitigate or correct hazards and risks, summarized in a “Daily Safety Report” to be submitted to BDD Management.

· Document all safety infractions/incidents by employees and subcontractors in Disciplinary Action Forms for presentation to HSE Manager – and final submission to BDD Management.

· Generate Incident Reports for all job-site injuries, equipment damage and “near-miss” events.

· Manage COVID cleaning efforts where required on vessels and facility’s overall COVID response.

**Record Keeping/Education**

· Maintain a filing system of safety infractions and incident reports.

· Support and facilitate training initiatives promulgated by HSE Manager.

· Host “Tool Box” talks for employees and subcontractors, providing education on various safety topics germane to shipyard operations.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Environmental health and Safety: 4 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* OSHA 30 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Direct Support Professional - Westchester Day Hab
description:
**Job Summary**

The Direct Support Professional (DSP) is responsible for supporting persons receiving services while promoting their personal, physical and emotional wellbeing. The primary role of the Direct Support Professional is to work alongside the people we support in order to help them to achieve their personal goals. The DSP ensures the delivery of Habilitation services, service plans or other OPWDD supports and documents and verifies daily data collection.

**About Abbott House**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults, and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Adheres to all regulations, policies, procedures and protocols set forth by NY OPWDD, NY Justice Center, Centers for Medicare/Medicaid and Abbott House.
* Establishes a positive working relationship with the individual, family and direct supervisor
* Maintains a professional demeanor when interacting with parents, guardians and other professionals.
* Expected to learn, and demonstrate skills outlined in the DSP Code of Ethics and DSP Core Competencies.
* Service can only be provided Monday through Friday between 9am and 3pm and only in the Community.
* To provide meaningful services to the individual out in the community. These services are about the individual and their choices.
* Implements outlined Habilitation and Behavioral Support plans/programs and documents accordingly. Maintain documentation for each service provided by completing a daily note, documenting the service on the Individual response sheet and completing a monthly summary
* Provide transportation to and from community outings. Candidate will need to use their own car and will be reimbursed for mileage
* Submit completed paperwork by the 3rd business day of the new month
* Attend individual’s Life Plan reviews to share the progress and any issues or concerns
* To keep lines of communication opened between Supervisor, House Manager, Care Coordinators and Families (if applicable)

**About You**

You are the ideal candidate if you are passionate about the social services field and empowering underserved communities. Being compassionate, organized, self-motivated, driven, flexible and responsive are critical attributes to be successful in this role.

* You have a High school diploma or GED
* You have a valid driver’s license
* Communicate effectively orally and in writing.
* One year experience working with people with developmental disabilities preferred.

title: Patient Care Coordinator (PCC)
description:
### **Our Mission**


Our mission is to provide the best healthcare possible in a kind and caring environment, in an economical manner, while respecting the rights of all our patients, at times and locations convenient to the patient.


### **Our Vision**


Have the most valued and trusted urgent cares in Colorado with over 10 locations in the cities of Denver and Aurora.


### **Our Values**


**PATIENT-ORIENTED**  

 **Satisfy and delight our patients**
  

**INTEGRITY** Be honest and take pride in everything you do
  

COMMUNITY Care about each other and Community with respect
  

ACCOMPLISHMENT Be resilient and committed to learning and growth
  

COMMUNICATION Be transparent and keep your team informed
  

### **Our People**


We share similar core values that drive us to bring the best of who we are to work every day. Every patient who walks through American Family Care doors deserves nothing less. These values include: a respect and consideration for others, honesty and integrity. It means compassion and kindness for all. Teamwork and a spirit of cooperation. Initiative and bringing excellence to everything we do. This is who we are.


### **Nominated as a Top Workplace of 2023 by The Denver Post!**


Each year, The Denver Post publishes their list of top workplaces as ranked by employees through a third-party survey, and AFC Urgent Care Denver has been nominated as one of the best in 2023.


Workplaces that are nominated to the Best of 2023 are measured based on key factors including alignment, execution, and connection of business goals. Workplace culture is also a major factor of our nomination with frequent bonding, professional development, and work-life balance opportunities.


We value the happiness and personal growth of all our team members, which created the award-winning culture here at AFC Denver.


### **Our Reputation**


AFC Urgent Care Denver is known for advanced patient care provided by expert physicians and staff, particularly in the areas of urgent care and occupational medicine. Our ability to provide state-of-the-art treatment stems from our commitment to team work, collaboration and first class patient care. We believe in ourselves, medicine, our company, our co-workers and our patients.


**Join the Team**
-----------------


### ***Live Life, Uninterrupted***


American Family Care is one of the nation’s leading providers of urgent care, accessible primary care, and occupational medicine. Across the country, in over 240 company-owned and franchise-owned clinics, we care for nearly 3 million patients a year. Ranked by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S., we invite you to grow with us and experience for yourself the satisfying and fulfilling work that the healthcare industry provides.


Join the revolution as we work to become one of the world’s most widely – known and admired brands in healthcare.


Please note that the position is for a franchise location. Each franchise-owned and operated location recruits, hires, trains, and manages its own employees, sets its own employment policies and procedures, and provides compensation and benefits determined by that franchise owner.


  
**Are you a passionate and compassionate healthcare professional?**


AFC Urgent Care-Denver is always seeking an energetic Patient Care Coordinator to join our team of dedicated health-care providers. As a vital member of our fast-paced clinic, you will make a direct impact on patient care.


Join one of Denver's top-rated Urgent Care clinics and experience a rewarding career!


**About the Role:**


A **Patient Care Coordinator** is a crucial role in healthcare, acting as a bridge between patients and healthcare providers. Their primary responsibility is to ensure patients receive the care they need in a timely and efficient manner.


**Reports to:** Regional Director/Supervision of Clinic Supervisor/ Shift Lead


**Pay Range:**


- $20.00 - $ 22.00 per hour (based on experience)


**Primary Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):**


* Greet patients in a professional, warm, friendly manner.
* Perform patient registration (enter into Experity, verify insurance, collect copays, check outstanding balances, etc).
* Perform patient discharge.
* Enter charges, scan charts and ensure patient files and charges are complete and accurate.
* Answer incoming calls in a professional manner – forward call or take message as appropriate.
* Coordinate faxes and referrals with other physicians and employers.
* Ensure cleanliness of patient waiting area and front office area.
* Verify patient insurance coverage and benefits

**Minimum Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent (required)
* Ability to working independently with excellent patient interaction skills
* Experience in a healthcare setting, preferably in patient care coordination or medical office administration.
* Minimum of 1 year experience in a medical office setting, (preferred)
* Excellent verbal communication and patient interaction skills.
* Experience with answering multi-phone line system
* Weekend availability (Saturday or Sunday)

**Skills and Abilities:**


* **Strong interpersonal skills:** Ability to communicate effectively with patients, healthcare providers, and insurance representatives.
* **Empathy and compassion:** Understanding and responding to patients' needs and concerns.
* **Organizational skills:** Efficiently managing patient schedules, records, and tasks.
* **Problem-solving skills:** Ability to resolve patient issues and conflicts.
* **Time management skills:** Prioritizing tasks and meeting deadlines.
* **Computer proficiency:** Familiarity with electronic health records (EHR) and other relevant software.
* **Attention to detail:** Ensuring accuracy in patient records and documentation.
* **Knowledge of medical terminology:** Understanding healthcare terminology and concepts.

### **Why Join Us?**


We offer competitive compensation, benefits and opportunities for professional growth.


* **Employee Assistance Program** – Access to free counseling sessions for help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues, and much more.
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans plus hospital indemnity, critical illness, accident coverage, STD, LTD, life insurance and FAMLI.
* **Paid Time Off:** Generous PTO and sick time to support your work-life balance
* **Growth Opportunities:** Be part of a fast-growing Urgent Care with ample chances for career advancement
* **401(k) Match:** Enjoy a 100% match up to 3% and a 50% match up to 5%
* **Bonuses:** Monthly incentives including 5-star bonuses and referral bonuses.

AFC Denver has 7 convenient locations. Find your perfect fit and apply today!


- Highlands (80211) - Havana (80012)  

* Speer (80203)
* Park Hill (80206)
* University Hills (80222)
* Leetsdale (80224)
* City Park (80207)
* Cherry Creek (80246)

  

If you’re ready to be part of a dynamic team where your contributions truly matter, we would love to hear from you! Ready to thrive? Apply to be part of Denver's best workplace.

#### **APP (FNP-C/PA-C) Position** **at AFC Urgent Care Denver**


#### ***Full-Time***


**Job Description for Advanced Practice Provider (Family Nurse Practitioner, Physician Assistant )at AFC Urgent Care Denver**


**Position:** Full-Time Advanced Practice Provider (APP)-Family Nurse Practitioner (FNP) or Physician Assistant (PA)


**Overview:** AFC Urgent Care Denver is always seeking experienced Advanced Practice Providers with a minimum of 2 years in Urgent Care, ER, or Family Practice. Candidates should have a strong bedside manner, enjoy patient interaction, and be able to work independently with a focus on patient care.


**Pay Range:** $134,000-$165,000, with a competitive bonus structure based on performance, including shift differentials for weekend work. The first 3 months offer 100% of bonus achievement.


**Responsibilities:**


* Function autonomously during solo shifts with ability to consult fellow providers and lead physicians as needed
* Provide patient-centric, evidence-based care for both adult and pediatric patients.
* Interpret and respond promptly to EKGs, X-rays, and lab results.
* Perform bedside procedures such as laceration repairs, I&Ds, foreign body removals, and joint injections/aspirations.
* Obtain DOT certification within 3 months.
* Efficiently manage high patient volume.
* Communicate effectively with clinic supervisors, medical assistants, and technicians.
* Work two full weekends per month (required for full-time providers) and some holidays.
* Be available to work at multiple clinic locations.
* Maintain high patient satisfaction and garner positive social media reviews.

**Leadership Opportunities:**


* Guide new APPs in peer mentor program to adapt to company culture.
* Guide potential provider candidates.
* Sign up to be a specialist in certain areas of clinical practice and education.
* Address and resolve patient complaints with clinic staff.
* Receptive to new services, quality-improvement projects and clinic protocols.
* Work closely with lead physicians and the Medical Director to adapt to company changes.

**Qualifications:**


* Medical/Master’s degree with certification.
* Current, unrestricted Colorado medical license.
* Unrestricted Colorado DEA license to prescribe controlled substances.
* BLS or ACLS certification.
* Experience in ER, urgent care, or fast-paced primary care.

**Why Join AFC Urgent Care Denver?**


* **Employee Assistance Program:** Free counseling for stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues.

title: Medical Assistant/EMT
description:
### **Our Mission**


Our mission is to provide the best healthcare possible in a kind and caring environment, in an economical manner, while respecting the rights of all our patients, at times and locations convenient to the patient.


### **Our Vision**


Have the most valued and trusted urgent cares in Colorado with over 10 locations in the cities of Denver and Aurora.


### **Our Values**


**PATIENT-ORIENTED**  

 **Satisfy and delight our patients**
  

**INTEGRITY** Be honest and take pride in everything you do
  

COMMUNITY Care about each other and Community with respect
  

ACCOMPLISHMENT Be resilient and committed to learning and growth
  

COMMUNICATION Be transparent and keep your team informed
  

### **Our People**


We share similar core values that drive us to bring the best of who we are to work every day. Every patient who walks through American Family Care doors deserves nothing less. These values include: a respect and consideration for others, honesty and integrity. It means compassion and kindness for all. Teamwork and a spirit of cooperation. Initiative and bringing excellence to everything we do. This is who we are.


### **Nominated as a Top Workplace of 2023 by The Denver Post!**


Each year, The Denver Post publishes their list of top workplaces as ranked by employees through a third-party survey, and AFC Urgent Care Denver has been nominated as one of the best in 2023.


Workplaces that are nominated to the Best of 2023 are measured based on key factors including alignment, execution, and connection of business goals. Workplace culture is also a major factor of our nomination with frequent bonding, professional development, and work-life balance opportunities.


We value the happiness and personal growth of all our team members, which created the award-winning culture here at AFC Denver.


### **Our Reputation**


AFC Urgent Care Denver is known for advanced patient care provided by expert physicians and staff, particularly in the areas of urgent care and occupational medicine. Our ability to provide state-of-the-art treatment stems from our commitment to team work, collaboration and first class patient care. We believe in ourselves, medicine, our company, our co-workers and our patients.


**Join the Team**
-----------------


### ***Live Life, Uninterrupted***


American Family Care is one of the nation’s leading providers of urgent care, accessible primary care, and occupational medicine. Across the country, in over 240 company-owned and franchise-owned clinics, we care for nearly 3 million patients a year. Ranked by Inc. Magazine as one of the fastest-growing companies in the U.S., we invite you to grow with us and experience for yourself the satisfying and fulfilling work that the healthcare industry provides.


Join the revolution as we work to become one of the world’s most widely – known and admired brands in healthcare.


Please note that the position is for a franchise location. Each franchise-owned and operated location recruits, hires, trains, and manages its own employees, sets its own employment policies and procedures, and provides compensation and benefits determined by that franchise owner.


  
**Are you a passionate and compassionate healthcare professional?**


AFC Urgent Care-Denver is always seeking energetic Medical Assistants to join our team of dedicated providers. As a vital member of our fast-paced clinic, you will make a direct impact on patient care. Join one of Denver's top-rated Urgent Care clinics and experience a rewarding career!


**About the Role:**


As a Medical Assistant, you will play a vital role in our fast-paced, patient-focused clinic. You will work closely with our dedicated team to ensure seamless patient care, from triaging patients and gathering medical records to preparing exam rooms and assisting physicians during treatments.


**Reports to:** Regional Director/Supervision of Clinic Supervisor and Shift Lead


**Pay Range:**


* $21-$25 per hour (based on experience)


**Primary Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):**


* Prepare patients for examinations and treatment by taking patient vitals and histories and discharge patients with care instructions
* Triage patients and gather medical records
* Administer medications and perform basic phlebotomy tasks
* Ensure accurate and up-to-date patient records
* Inventory supplies, and replenish supplies when received
* Help in maintaining the medical equipment maintenance
* Additional duties as required

**Minimum Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent (required)
* Experience with EMR systems (Experity preferred)
* Previous experience in a medical office setting (Preferred)
* Medical Assistant Diploma required; certification preferred
* Ability to work independently with excellent patient interaction skills
* Weekend availability (Saturday or Sunday)

### **Why Join Us?**


**We offer competitive compensation, benefits and opportunities for professional growth.**


* **Employee Assistance Program** – Access to free counseling sessions for help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues, and much more
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans plus hospital indemnity, critical illness, accident coverage, STD, LTD, life insurance and FAMLI.
* **Paid Time Off:** Generous PTO and sick time to support your work-life balance
* **Growth Opportunities:** Be part of a fast-growing Urgent Care with ample chances for career advancement
* **401(k) Match:** Enjoy a 100% match up to 3% and a 50% match up to 5%
* **Bonuses:** Monthly incentives including 5-star bonuses and referral bonuses

AFC Denver has 7 clinics, if you are interested in any of the ones listed below, we encourage you to apply!


* Highlands (80211)
* Havana (80012)


- Speer (80203) - Park Hill (80206)  

* University Hills (80222)
* Leetsdale (80224)
* Cherry Creek (80246)

  

If you’re ready to be part of a dynamic team where your contributions truly matter, we would love to hear from you! Ready to thrive? Apply to be part of Denver's best workplace.

**Are you a passionate and compassionate healthcare professional?**


AFC Urgent Care-Denver is always seeking energetic Medical Scribes to join our team of dedicated health care providers. As a vital member of our fast-paced clinic, you will make a direct impact on patient care. Join one of Denver's top-rated Urgent Care clinics and experience a rewarding career!


**About the Role:**


The role of a **Medical Scribe** involves providing real-time documentation support to physicians and healthcare providers. This includes capturing detailed and accurate patient information during medical examinations and procedures, and ensuring all relevant data is recorded in the electronic health record (EHR) system. The scribe's responsibilities help streamline the documentation process, allowing healthcare providers to focus more on patient care.


**Pay Range:**


* $21 / hour with bonus opportunities up to extra $2 / hour per hour (based on experience)

**Primary Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):**


* You will be a scribe for many different types of medical providers including MDs, DOs, PAs, and NPs.
* Assist in gathering patient information and history, ensuring that all relevant details are captured accurately.
* Tasked with creating an accurate and detailed medical chart in our EMR from start to finish for providers.
* Accurately and efficiently document patient medical history, symptoms, diagnoses, and treatment plans.
* Processing medical orders, such as lab tests, imaging studies, and prescriptions.
* Maintain patient confidentiality and comply with HIPAA regulations and other relevant privacy laws.
* Document any medical data as directed by providers.
* Handling various administrative tasks, such as filing, copying, and scheduling appointments.
* Cross-training and perform all other duties as assigned by the provider. Perform other clerical tasks that optimize efficiency.

**Must also have:**


* Basic knowledge of med terms, anatomy, physiology, and medications.
* Excellent active listening skills. You will be required to listen to multiple people talking, gather your own thoughts, and record them at the same time.
* Effective communication with physicians and patients.
* Strong clinical skills and work ethic.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Efficiently managing multiple tasks and prioritizing work.
* Availability from 8:00am - 8:00pm Thursday, Friday, and Saturday OR Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday.

**Minimum Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or equivalent (required)
* Experience with EMR systems (Experity preferred)
* Previous experience in a medical office setting (Preferred)
* Ability to work independently with excellent patient interaction skills
* Weekend availability (Saturday or Sunday)

### **Why Join Us?**


**We offer competitive compensation, benefits and opportunities for professional growth.**

* **Employee Assistance Program** – Access to free counseling sessions for help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues, and much more
* **Comprehensive Benefits:** Competitive Medical, Dental and Vision plans plus hospital indemnity, critical illness, accident coverage, STD, LTD, life insurance and FAMLI.
* **Paid Time Off:** Generous PTO and sick time to support your work-life balance
* **Growth Opportunities:** Be part of a fast-growing Urgent Care with ample chances for career advancement

title: Middle School Activity Specialist - Podcasting
description:
**Job Description**

**SUMMARY:**  
We are seeking an Activity Specialist for our after-school program located at 171-10 Linden Blvd Jamaica, NY 11434. The Activity Specialist is responsible for implementing and leading engaging activities for **middle school** students in the after-school program. The Activity Specialist would have knowledge and experience in **podcasts.**  The instructor is expected to implement programs that provide scholars the skills to build and create their own podcasts. **Applicants must have a strong background in podcasting.**

**Tuesday and Thursday - 2:30pm-5:30pm**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Ensure the safety of children
* Able to engage all children in assigned activities, so that no child is left behind
* Develop weekly activity lesson plans in area(s) of specialty
* Ready and prepared to facilitate purposeful activities that foster the development of new skills in children, while reinforcing skills/information previously taught
* Assist in all program activities, which could include supervising children, facilitating dismissal, attending field trips that might be outside of regular hours, hosting special events and other program activities
* Works closely with the Group Leader, engaging them in the lesson plan development
* Attend all meetings, training workshops, and special events, which might be after regular hours
* Complete 15 hours of professional development each calendar year
* Conduct yourself as a positive role model
* Knowledge of DYCD and DOH mandates

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Appropriate training or certification in their area of specialty; college students welcome; college degree preferred
* Minimum of one year experience working with middle school-aged children
* Exceptional group management, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Competency in youth development and child care
* Ability to create interactive academic and/or enrichment activities that are age-appropriate
* Genuine enthusiasm for developing professional skills through training opportunities and field practice
* Ability to work as part of a team within a school community
* Ability to communicate and work effectively and respectfully with other employees
* Reliable and cooperative

**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**

* College degree preferred, college students welcome
* Minimum of one year experience working with middle-school-age children

**Job Type**: Part-time

**Salary**: $30.00 per hour

Staff members are subject to random drug testing throughout the school year and before they begin working.

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP) - Rockland County
description:
***Newly hired, full-time, DSP’s will receive a $2,000 bonus after completion of 1-year of active, full-time employment.***

**We are seeking DSPs for our Rockland County residential programs in New City, Pomona and Spring Valley, as well as our Day Hab programs in New City and Orangeburg, NY.**

Day Program Schedules Available- 7am-3pm/8am-4pm

Residential Program Schedules Available- Morning Shift. Evening Shift, & Overnight Shift

**Job Description**

Abbott House is seeking compassionate Direct Support Professionals (DSP) to work directly with adults with intellectual disabilities while promoting their personal, physical and emotional wellbeing. The primary role of the Direct Support Professional is to work alongside the people we support in order to help them to achieve their personal goals. The DSP ensures the delivery of Habilitation services, service plans or other OPWDD supports and documents and verifies daily data collection.

**About Abbott House**

Abbott House is an innovative community-based organization that helps children, families, adults and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities with complex needs build lasting foundations for a promising future. We operate programs in the New York Metropolitan area and Hudson Valley.

**Key Responsibilities**

1. Establish positive working relationships with persons receiving services, co-workers, management and the public.

2. Maintain a professional demeanor when interacting with parents, guardians and other professionals.

3. Implement outlined Habilitation and Behavioral Support plans/programs.

4. Assist with personal care of persons receiving support as needed.

5. Administer prescribed medications to persons receiving supports after successful completion of AMAP medication administration course.

6. Assist individuals with planning and participating in the community activities.

7. Drive agency vehicles for transportation of persons receiving supports and adheres to all related vehicle operation policies.

**About You**

You are the ideal candidate if you are enjoy working in the social services field while empowering underserved communities. Being compassionate, reliable, self-motivated, and a team player are critical attributes to be successful in this role.

* You have a High school diploma or GED
* You have a valid driver’s license
* You have good counseling, communication, and interpersonal skills

**What We Offer:**

* Professional growth opportunities
* Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug and Vision Care benefits with premiums substantially paid by for employees, employee families and domestic partners
* Generous vacation, holiday, sick time and personal time off benefits
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Company paid life insurance and long-term Disability Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Short-term disability and Workers Compensation benefits
* Paid Family Leave Program
* Employee Recognition Awards

description:
**Job Overview**

Begin the process of becoming a Capture Specialist!

**https://onsiteiq.formtitan.com/ftproject/recruiting**

Capture Specialists are an integral part of the construction process, providing the raw videos used to make sure Real Estate investors are always up-to-date on the status of their projects. Capture Specialists walk job sites each week and use a 360º camera to capture hi-res videos of 100% of the job site.

IMPORTANT NOTE: OnsiteIQ only offers project-based work which means you accept a project(s) in your market as they come available. Projects range from a few hours a month all the way to a full time capacity, although full time work is rare.

**What do we do?**

OnsiteIQ is a construction intelligence platform that brings construction sites to its users. We map 360-degree imagery to architectural floor plans. This enables clients to virtually walk through these sites monitoring progress, finding & tracking issues, collaborating with project stakeholders, & more.

**What do you do?**

* Capture
* Upload
* Get paid

**Qualifications & Requirements**

* Strong communication skills
* Flexible schedule
* Positive attitude
* Patience/Adaptability
* Reliability
* Home internet connection
* Laptop/computer for upload
* OSHA 10 certification \\*within 30 days

Want more information? Visit us at https://www.onsiteiq.io/capture-specialists/.

Pay: $125.00 per day

description:

title: Associate Director, IT Business Partner
description:
Position Summary
Role will provide financial support for the Information Technology Infrastructure and Hosting (I&H) team, responsible for close collaboration with Finance team members, Procure To Pay, Vendor Management and Strategic Sourcing departments. You will create, maintain, and adjust departmental budget, monthly accruals, monthly spend analysis and creation/tracking of Purchase Requests and Purchase Orders. Candidate will also be responsible to manage vendor and contract worker on-boarding activities, negotiation of Statements of Work (SOWs), vendor agreements. I&H is heavily invested in Cloud technologies, you will demonstrate experience managing, reporting and supporting associated cloud billing and financial reviews. This is a key role for the success of the IT and I&H teams.
Position responsibilities
IT BUISNESS PARTNER RESPONSIBILITIES:* Experience in IT / business operations analysis and management, which includes review of monthly close and financial results, managing and reconciling infrastructure costs, planning and forecasts for project expenses, as well as develop and deliver executive level reporting.
* Strong understanding of financial processes, strong communication skills (written and oral), and strong analytic skills
* Oversee the enforcement of business analysis processes, departmental standards, style requirements and all other procedures necessary to meet the business objectives and quality standards for IT deliveries. Recommend, design and monitor IT process improvement activities aimed at reducing costs, improving quality and speed to market.
* Support the IT organization to manage financial targets and KPIs while still achieving key business objectives.
* Collaborate with the IT Finance Business Relationship Manager, IT Leadership and various business partners to direct IT investments in support of the overall Finance business strategy. Develop business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for IT spending and initiatives.
* Collaborate with other managers and leaders to achieve key business and technology goals. Become a trusted advisor to finance leadership team.
* Experience successfully managing large scale Finance technology transformation programs, project implementations, systems support and enhancements.
* Experience in building efficient operating models to support the Finance technology needs of a growing and change-oriented company.


PROCUREMENT/CONTRACT REPSONSIBILITIES:* Demonstrated analytical and contract negotiation skills.
* Plan, organize and carry out multiple related sourcing and contracting activities simultaneously.
* Familiarity with SAP ARIBA procurement systems
* Create and manage Purchase Orders.
* Ensure correct coding and tracking to budget/ forecast.
* Close and/or extend Purchase Orders when appropriate.
* Track and report against I&H IT Purchase Orders by business area.
* Negotiate SOWs/ Quotes in coordination with I&H IT lead.
* Partner with I&H IT Vendor Management and others as needed to finalize contracts.
* Manage all vendor onboarding activities.
* Track contract end dates and ensure renewals are completed in advance of expirations (e.g., MSAs, SOWs, SLAs, software renewals, etc.)
* Provide procurement related reporting.
* Capital Requests and Tracking


CLOUD SUPPORT RESONSIBILITIES:* Responsible for working with the engineering and business teams to understand the future cloud service demand forecast and manage infrastructure capacity forecast.
* Develop cost allocation models for shared services.
* Identify incorrect tagging guidelines to ensure appropriate categorization of cloud costs.
* Experience with defining boundaries to enable and optimize cost performance.
* Identify cloud cost optimization opportunities including partnering with IT strategists and architects to identify cost effective alternatives.


Knowledge, Skills, Competencies, Education, and Experience
REQUIRED:* Bachelor's degree or equivalent
* Minimum 5-10 years of relevant work experience (e.g., finance, vendor management, etc.)
* Accounting and/or Finance Operations experience is required.
* Strong understanding of finance concepts
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills are required.
* Proficiency using MS Excel
* Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of the organization.
* Strong negotiation and collaboration skills


PREFERED:* Experience in Pharmaceutical Industry is beneficial.
* Experience successfully managing large scale Finance technology transformation programs, project implementations, systems support and enhancements.
* Experience in building efficient operating models to support the Finance technology needs of a growing and change-oriented company.
* Ability to effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously with aggressive deadlines.
* Experienced with financial systems such as SAP HANA, SAP ARIBA/ Oracle etc.– required.
* Knowledge of Procure-To-Pay (PTP) and associated activities.
* Familiarity with global budgeting
* Experience building dashboards and visualizations for related reporting.
* Intellectually curious with a desire to understand the business beyond the scope of day-to-day responsibilities.
* In-depth knowledge of indirect spend categories, specifically Information Technology Hardware, Software, Telecommunications, and Outsourcing.


Competencies  

Accountability for Results - Stay focused on key strategic objectives, be accountable for high standards of performance, and take an active role in leading change.  

Strategic Thinking & Problem Solving - Make decisions considering the long-term impact to customers, patients, employees, and the business.  

Patient & Customer Centricity - Maintain an ongoing focus on the needs of our customers and/or key stakeholders.  

Impactful Communication - Communicate with logic, clarity, and respect. Influence at all levels to achieve the best results for Otsuka.  

Respectful Collaboration - Seek and value others’ perspectives and strive for diverse partnerships to enhance work toward common goals.  

Empowered Development - Play an active role in professional development as a business imperative.
Come discover more about Otsuka and our benefit offerings; https://www.otsuka-us.com/careers-join-otsuka.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed by the people assigned to this position. It is not intended to include every job duty and responsibility specific to the position. Otsuka reserves the right to amend and change responsibilities to meet business and organizational needs as necessary.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will be given consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, religion, national origin, veteran status, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic.  

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation, if you are unable or limited in your ability to apply to this job opening as a result of your disability. You can request reasonable accommodations by contacting Accommodation Request.
Statement Regarding Job Recruiting Fraud Scams
At Otsuka we take security and protection of your personal information very seriously. Please be aware individuals may approach you and falsely present themselves as our employees or representatives. They may use this false pretense to try to gain access to your personal information or acquire money from you by offering fictitious employment opportunities purportedly on our behalf.
Please understand, Otsuka will never ask for financial information of any kind or for payment of money during the job application process. We do not require any financial, credit card or bank account information and/or any payment of any kind to be considered for employment. We will also not offer you money to buy equipment, software, or for any other purpose during the job application process. If you are being asked to pay or offered money for equipment fees or some other application processing fee, even if claimed you will be reimbursed, this is not Otsuka. These claims are fraudulent and you are strongly advised to exercise caution when you receive such an offer of employment.
Otsuka will also never ask you to download a third-party application in order to communicate about a legitimate job opportunity. Scammers may also send offers or claims from a fake email address or from Yahoo, Gmail, Hotmail, etc, and not from an official Otsuka email address. Please take extra caution while examining such an email address, as the scammers may misspell an official Otsuka email address and use a slightly modified version duplicating letters.
To ensure that you are communicating about a legitimate job opportunity at Otsuka, please only deal directly with Otsuka through its official Otsuka Career website https://vhr-otsuka.wd1.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/External.
Otsuka will not be held liable or responsible for any claims, losses, damages or expenses resulting from job recruiting scams. If you suspect a position is fraudulent, please contact Otsuka’s call center at: 800-363-5670. If you believe you are the victim of fraud resulting from a job recruiting scam, please contact the FBI through the Internet Crime Complaint Center at: https://www.ic3.gov, or your local authorities.
Otsuka America Pharmaceutical Inc., Otsuka Pharmaceutical Development & Commercialization, Inc., and ODH, Inc. (“Otsuka”) does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs/resumes submitted by search firms to any Otsuka employee directly or through Otsuka’s application portal without a valid written search agreement in place for the position will be considered Otsuka’s sole property. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired by Otsuka as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

title: School Aide
description:
School Aide Posting:

IS 289 is looking for a school aide. Basic responsibilities include yard, hall, lavatory, and other monitorial and patrol duties; Handle, store, and distribute textbooks, instructional supplies and materials; Assist with clerical work of a routine nature; Assist in maintaining order in the lunchroom; Maintain school inventories. Minimum Selection Criteria: Excellent record of attendance and punctuality; Demonstrated ability to work with supervisors and other school-based staff; Demonstrated history of good human relations; Demonstrated ability to efficiently carry out assignments; Knowledge of CSE procedures.

Preferred Selection Criteria: Bilingual

Additional Information about IS 289

IS 289 is a 300-student District 2 middle school (grades 6-8) in Battery Park City, Manhattan. The school attracts students from all of the elementary schools in District 2 to create a culturally diverse student body. Teachers create rich interdisciplinary curricula that engage students’ interests in, and concern about, the world around them. IS 289’s program encourages students to actively participate in their learning and to work collaboratively with one another. The school is located on the 4th and 5th floors of 201 Warren Street.

IS 289’s classrooms are well-equipped with up-to-date technology; students have easy access to laptops and tablets with which to do on-line research, design iBooks, create iMovies, write blogs, etc. IIS 289 uses a workshop structure for all of its classes; classes are 40 to 90 minutes long and include a mini-lesson, extended work time during which students work on labs and unit projects individually or in collaborative groups, and a final processing meeting.

title: Merchant
description:
Reporting to the Senior Director of Merchandising, this role is a key player in Roller Rabbit's growth. The Merchant will be responsible for developing and executing merchandising strategies to maximize profitability, optimize inventory, and refine product assortment for an enhanced customer experience. This role involves partnering with the Senior Director of Merchandising on product assortments, sales plans, product pricing, and margin performance. They will work closely in partnership with planning and allocations to ensure strategic buying and inventory productivity. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for trends, be highly motivated, and the ability to work collaboratively with design, pd/production, marketing, ecommerce, and retail teams.
### **Description**


**What You’ll Do:*** Develop and implement merchandising strategies to align with the company's overall objectives and target market.
* Conduct research on fashion trends, market conditions, and consumer preferences to inform merchandise selection and pricing strategies.
* Analyze historical sales data and industry trends to identify opportunities for growth regularly.
* Suggest and help implement improvements to cross functional processes and tools.
* Partner with Senior Planning Manager on managing inventory levels to balance supply with demand, minimize stockouts and overstock.
* Assist in building seasonal roadmaps for design articulating newness needs per delivery with sku targets, as well as clear direction on carry forward products (where updates or newness is needed)
* Partner with the Senior Director of Merchandising on the selection of merchandise, ensuring it meets customer needs and aligns with brand identity.
* Support the Senior Planning Manager with unit buys for seasonal, core and in season reorders.
* Establish and maintain a ‘core items’ list each quarter, forecasting styles and colorways that will be significant contributors to the business.
* Develop highly collaborative relationships with all departments including planning, production, PD, design, marketing, ecomm and retail.
* Top of FormBottom of FormBuild effective relationships with store staff and gather feedback on product and customer preferences and issues.
* Provide training and guidance to store staff on product knowledge and merchandising techniques.

 **Qualifications:*** Bachelor’s degree in fashion merchandising, business, marketing, or a related field
* 3 to 5 years’ experience in fashion merchandising, buying, or a similar role in a retail environment
* Excellent analytical skills and business acumen
* Innate understanding of fashion trends, consumer behavior, and market dynamics
* Proven history of successfully driving sales results
* High taste level
* Self-starter
* Must be detail oriented, organized, and flexible
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
* Experience with Shopify, Report Pundit, and Toolio is a plus
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite

 **Our Best Fit Candidate Would Be:*** Strong team player – brings a positive approach to new and challenging projects.
* Knowing the Roller Rabbit brand and understanding what it takes to build the brand.
* Proven ability to objectively evaluate data and extract actionable insights to drive the business.
* Excellent collaboration and communication skills
* Highly motivated, self-starting individual & strategic thinker.
* Must be hands on and enjoy working in a highly creative and entrepreneurial environment.
* Strong interpersonal and communications skills (verbal and written)
* Demonstrate strong project management, team leadership and the ability to deliver results.

 **What We Offer:*** **Medical, Dental & Vision**
* Unlimited PTO
* Company Discount & Allowance
and More  
* 
  

#### **Salary**


$75,000 - $90,000 per year

title: Private Equity Associate
description:
**Job Overview:**The Deal Sourcing Specialist will be responsible for identifying, evaluating, and sourcing potential acquisition targets for SBI Equity Group. This role involves building and maintaining a robust pipeline of investment opportunities aligned with the firm’s strategic goals.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Deal Sourcing and Pipeline Management:**
* Identify and evaluate potential acquisition targets in the technology, healthcare, manufacturing, consumer products, real estate, and construction sectors.
* Build and manage a pipeline of high-quality investment opportunities.
* Conduct preliminary analysis and due diligence to assess the suitability of targets.
* **Networking and Relationship Building:**
* Develop and maintain relationships with industry professionals, including brokers, bankers, consultants, and business owners.
* Attend industry events, conferences, and trade shows to network and source deals.
* Leverage existing relationships to uncover proprietary deal flow.
* **Market Research and Analysis:**
* Conduct market research to identify trends, opportunities, and emerging sectors.
* Analyze industry landscapes and competitive environments to inform sourcing strategies.
* Provide insights and recommendations to the COO and M&A team based on market analysis.
* **Collaboration with M&A Team:**
* Work closely with the COO and M&A team to evaluate and prioritize acquisition targets.
* Participate in deal negotiations and contribute to the development of acquisition strategies.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in deal sourcing, business development, or a similar role within private equity or investment banking.
* Strong networking skills and an established network of industry contacts.
* Excellent analytical and research skills.
* Self-motivated, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.

**Compensation:**Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses, and benefits package.

title: Home Infusion Registered Nurse - Per diem
description:
**Jesdit Infusion LLC Updated Job Description**

Jesdit Infusion is a fast-growing company that is seeking highly skilled and compassionate nurses throughout the New Jersey area. The primary role of a home infusion nurse is to provide clinical care, education, and excellent customer service to patients in their private residence and ambulatory infusions sites, where available. All infusion therapies, medications and medical supplies are provided by pharmacies and authorized by the patient’s doctor. As an in-home infusion nurse, not only will you be treating the patient, you will also have to work collaboratively with pharmacies and doctors to provide the highest quality care for your patients. This position does require traveling to patient homes, and an ideal candidate will be able to travel at least 40-45 minutes from their home to visit their patients for the duration of their treatment and be comfortable in diverse home settings.

Requirements:

* Current, unrestricted RN license for the state of New Jersey
* BLS/ACLS certification
* Valid driver’s license and auto insurance
* Clean background check
* In-depth knowledge of HIPPA policies and procedures
* Personal Liability Insurance
* Reliable personal transportation.
* Must have excellent IV skills (CRNI preferred)
* Competent at PICC line maintenance, port access/de-access Midline and PIV placement
* Minimum of 2 years of infusion experience. An ideal candidate will have experience with IVIG, SCIG, TPN, Remicade, Gammunex, Gammaguard, Entyvio and antibiotics such as Vancomycin Daptomycin etc.
* Bachelors degree in Nursing is preferred
* In-depth understanding of regulatory compliance with state and federal regulators
* Strong interpersonal skills and ability to interact with all patients and their families in a compassionate and professional manner
* Pediatric care competency highly preferred but not required

Duties

Job duties vary by patient, medication, and doctor orders. All patients, unless specified otherwise, are to be seen on a weekly or monthly basis. While not an exhaustive list, duties include:

* Picc line dressing changes
* Port accessing/de-accessing.
* Lab draws,
* Patient assessment and teaching
* Troubleshoot equipment issues with patient (ad hoc basis)
* Milrinone hookups and bag changes
* Chemo disconnects (home setting or hospital setting)
* Infusing medication such as IVIG, SCIG, antibiotics, Remicade, Stelara, Solumedrol, Entyvio, Orencia, IV hydration and TPN
* Starting a PIV line and drawing blood for lab work and for infusions
* Deliver blood specimens to Labcorp or another lab facility (ad hoc basis)
* Fill out and submit all paperwork in a timely manner per company policy.

Schedule

Due to the nature of this position, the ability to work weekdays, weekends, days and nights are required. Must have a flexible schedule to devote at least 1 day a week to taking care of a minimum of 3 weekly cases.

Pay Rate

Regular Visit: Flat rate of $80.00 (includes initial assessment, medication education, medication administration, weekly bloodwork, weekly picc line dressing changes, port access/de-access, and chemo disconnect.

Hourly Rate: $50.00 an hour.

title: Member Navigator
description:
Summary of Position
* Provide support and assistance to mainstream Medicare, Medicaid, HARP, Child Health Plus and Essential members telephonically (inbound and outbound) with a variety of non‐clinical healthcare and membership needs: completing health care gaps, health related assessments, and state required applications to ensure continuous eligibility of healthcare coverage.
* Facilitate and aid Medicaid, HARP, CHP members as NYS Certified Application Counselor with state redetermination process including educating members on state qualifications, necessary proof of income and associated documents while completing required applications and submission to the state.
* Proactively lead, facilitate, and assess member experience through targeted Medicare member outreach, including members with multiple complex issues, grievance and appeal cases as well as access to care challenges to continually improve healthcare performance and consumers assessment of EH ability to provide high quality services.
* Navigate and provide direction and guidance during member interactions utilizing extensive knowledge of EmblemHealth’s products, complex processes, and multiple systems to enhance member’s health journey.
* Responsible to grow/increase membership enrollments in value added services: Member Portal, Medicare Rewards, Auto Pay and Paperless through telephonic member interactions, etc.


Roles and Responsibilities
* Provide seamless care coordination and individual needs assessments from member onboarding and throughout member lifecycle to support Medicare, Medicaid, HARP, and CHP members with care/risk health gaps and health risk assessment.
* Provide member assistance with initial and annual health assessments.
* Identify members qualifying for Care Management programs and resources and collaborate through referrals to Care Management Team.
* Assist, coordinate and schedule members with primary care and specialty visits, tests and necessary screenings.
* Intermediary and professional liaison with member and healthcare providers and provider facilities.
* Meet state mandated deadlines maintaining and acting with a sense of urgency.
* Facilitate and aid Medicaid, HARP, CHP members as NYS Certified Application Counselor with New York State of
* Health redetermination process including educating members on state qualifications, necessary proof of income and associated required documents while completing application and submission to the state.
* Lead and facilitate complex application issues including mixed immigration status households, multi‐tax household, family enrollment issues and complex income situations.
* Intermediary and professional liaison with the member and New York State of Health for coverage determinations including handling and submitting sensitive member information.
* Proactively lead, facilitate, and assess member experience through targeted Medicare member outreach, including members with multiple complex issues, grievance and appeal cases as well as access to care challenges to continually improve healthcare performance and consumers assessment to provide high quality services.
* Provide guidance, advice, and direction; and engage team members to solve for member issues.
* Collaborate and provide feedback to Director of Customer Retention and Loyalty team to understand member pain points and identify opportunities to mitigate.
* Onboard newly state assigned members and serve as guide for member plan and benefits. Set member expectations and enroll members in EH value added services including Member Portal, Member Rewards, Auto Pay while identifying member communications preferences including paperless.
* Retain members targeted for termination of plan by New York State of Health. Assist and educate members on next steps, required paperwork; and institute temporary plan extensions for resolution. Retain members targeted for termination of plan due to lack of premium payment. Assist member in payment options and avoid loss of coverage.
* Support goals of the department by meeting quarterly with Customer Retention and Loyalty leadership team to review results and discuss ways to continually improve member satisfaction, loyalty, revenue (Quality and Risk Scores) and reduce costs.
* Participate in weekly meetings with manager and team members to discuss customer concerns, improvement opportunities (people, processes, and technology), and other company priorities.
* Assist, support, and conduct user acceptance testing as appropriate and outside of normal business hours.
* Participate in state meetings as needed.
* Ongoing learning of EmblemHealth and Connecticare products and services, including any recent changes in business rules or decisions that may impact customer experience.
* Perform other duties assigned, directed, or required.


Qualifications
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Additional experience/specialized training may be considered in lieu of degree requirements required
* Must have NYS Certified Application Counselor certification; or obtain certification within 90 days of hire date as a condition of continued employment. Must maintain up to date, valid certification status to remain employed in the role.
* 3 – 5+ years of experience working with members in customer service, medical or managed care environment required
* Experience communicating directly with customers, assessing needs, and connecting customers with resources required
* Knowledgeable on how to navigate all aspects of medical care and managed care system; health and wellness preferred
* Knowledge of healthcare related regulations, processes, services, and products preferred
* Ability to demonstrate excellent service knowledge and hospitality required
* Technologically savvy, with the ability to quickly learn and navigate different information technology systems required
* Flexibility to travel to, and work in a physical office site when needed required
* Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc.) required
* Strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal) with all types/levels of audience required
Additional Information

title: Provider Contract Manager
description:
Summary of Position

Manage high profile provider contracts via consistent relationship development and high touch coordination of issue resolution. Act as a liaison and operates as a vital link between specific Facility, Ancillary, Delegated and/or Professional providers and EmblemHealth. Develop provider contracting efforts, including but not limited to process oversight, strategic diligence, outreach, and contract negotiations. Responsible for day to day operations for all activities related to contracts, contract optimization, implementation of new programs and to assist with provider issues, education materials, as well as communication of Plan policies and procedures. Contact for all escalated issues from the Provider and internal EmblemHealth departments, including grievances, disputes, and provider/member billing complaints. Provide guidance, training and support to contract specialist to ensure optimal contract management and outcomes.

“Provider” can include managing entity for health systems, facilities such as a specialty office, large faculty and group practices, delegated relationships, ancillary or ambulatory centers and the like.

Responsibilities:
* Recommend innovative contracting strategies to maximize cost containment, access and quality through provider arrangements.
* Identify contractual and system improvements to streamline process and resolve issues more timely.
* Negotiate and communicate contract terms, payment structures, and reimbursement rates to providers.
* Remain current on provider reimbursement methodologies and identify provider reimbursement trends to assist in the development of provider contracting strategies.
* Assist providers in all matters related to contract disputes and ensure accurate contract and rate load implementations are done in a timely manner.
* Communicate independently with providers and respond to provider inquiries in a timely, accurate, and professional manner.
* Responsible for ongoing network participation and performance, including performance analytics and management, as well as contract renewals and terminations.
* Analyze financial impact of contracts and terms.
* Provide timely completion/coordination of claim inquiries and complaints for the Hospital, Ancillary, and/or Professional network. This includes the coordinating of Joint Operating Committees (JOCs), claim review and resolution and support of audits when needed.
* Responsible for the accuracy of all documentation in support of contracts.
* Serve participating providers when issues require coordination of various Plan departments. These departments include but are not limited to Claims, Care Management, EDI, Grievance and Appeal, Customer Service, Enrollment, Special Investigations, and Credentialing.
* Provide timely, useful, and accurate responses to provider requests. This includes but is not limited to provider requests for Plan materials, and provider questions regarding fees, the Plan’s website and IVR, information in the Plan’s Provider Manual, and escalated claim inquiries.
* Optimize interactions with assigned high profile providers ensuring high touch issue resolution and account management. to establish and maintain productive, professional relationships.
* Ensure and coordinate notification and education of various departments within the EH on contract terms and related issues and conditions.
* Coordinate delegated credentialing functions and activities.
* Ensure the accuracy of provider demographic data in the Plan’s database. This includes but is not limited to reviewing provider data for assigned Providers, handling provider requests for demographic changes, researching provider address discrepancies identified by provider returned mail and potential provider demographic errors identified by other Plan departments or initiatives.
* May recruit available providers to fulfill Network deficiencies.
* Perform outreach projects which may include requests by the Plan’s State Sponsored Programs Department for DOH, IPRO and DOI notices, HEDIS medical record retrieval and other projects as needed. All outreach documented in compliance with department standards.
* Provide guidance, training and support to contract specialist to ensure optimal contract management and outcomes.


Qualifications:

* Bachelors’ degree in Health Care-related field, Public Administration, or Management
* 4- 6 years of direct provider relations experience required
* Knowledge of provider and payor roles, responsibilities and challenges. An understanding of health care financing, access issues, delivery systems, quality controls, and legislation required
* Strong customer service skills and the ability to maintain an excellent rapport with providers and their staff required
* Ability to work well with various Plan departments is instrumental in the effectiveness of the position required
* Excellent communication skills, written and verbal, to ensure that the appropriate requests are articulated and that problems are accurately represented for resolution required
* Time management skills and flexibility to work on multiple projects/assignments simultaneously, with ability to change focus in a crisis situation. Willingness to assume diverse duties and challenges required
* Interpersonal skills to effectively maintain working relationships to get issues resolved or to obtain information through people, and to represent the Plan and the Department in a favorable light required
* Ability to work independently assignments and maximize opportunities to support required
* Analytical and problem-solving skills to identify needs in provider relationships, make recommendations as projects develop and follow through to resolution using available resources to achieve a solution required
* Proficiency testing in Excel, Word and other Microsoft applications required
* PC skills including proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite required


Additional Information


* Requisition ID: 1000002037
* Hiring Range: $72,000-$138,000

title: Social Worker BSW CSW
description:
**Social Worker BSW CSW**  

SPPA Monroe
  

  

The Social Worker BSW CSW will:  

* Identify patients requiring social work services.  

	+ Respond to all patient/family referrals the same day that request is received as evidenced by documentation in the Medical Record.
* Assess the needs of patients referred/identified as appropriate to the ages of the patients and to the developmental life cycle stage (Adults & Geriatrics).
	+ Evaluate patient and/or family to ensure appropriate sources of information within 48 hours of receipt of referral.
	+ Review chart and confer with Physician, Nursing and/or other relevant healthcare staff within 48 hours.
	+ Accurately identify the patients presenting problem(s) relevant to the patient's condition.
	+ Accurately assess the impact of identified problems on the patient/family.
* Formulate treatment goal(s) for each assigned patient as appropriate to the ages of the patients and to the developmental life cycle stage.
	+ Develop realistic attainable goals and plans in cooperation with the patient/family.
	+ Identify resources relevant to treatment goals.
* Implement the service plan as appropriate to the ages of the patients and to the developmental life cycle stage.
	+ Provide supportive counseling to patients and families with empathy and concern.
	+ Identify and utilize appropriate intervention strategies and counseling and education techniques.
	+ Maintain necessary written and verbal communications with referral to appropriate agencies/institutions.
	+ Educate and assist patient/family in securing adequate available resources, services, and facilities based upon assessed as measured by outcome of intervention and documentation including but not limited to referral for crisis intervention.
* Function as an interdisciplinary team member in a specialty area.
	+ Interpret psychosocial information which has implications for the team plan in a timely and effective manner.
	+ Initiate and coordinate appropriate patient/family and team conferences.
* Develop and maintain community relations.
	+ Respond in 24-48 hours to all requests from community agency representatives for information and assistance.
	+ Identify and report gaps in the service delivery system and takes constructive action to remediate the situation.
	+ Educate co-workers about new resources/community programs at department staff meetings.
	+ Prepare and present lectures and programs requiring social work expertise as requested.
	+ Attend community functions to represent Saint Peter's Physician Associates - Monroe at least once a year.
* Participate in professional staff development and Hospital/Community activities to maintain skills and enhance professional visibility.
	+ Attend departmental meetings.
	+ Attend all mandatory in-service updates on an annual basis (e.g., Fire and Safety, Infection Control).
	+ Attend at least one (1) relevant professional meeting/ conference to maintain and upgrade skills.
	+ Accept opportunities that are presented to participate in a leadership role in relevant professional, and Community programs.
	+ Educate and orient other members of the health care team as to the role of social work in patient care.
	+ Identify training needs and recommends staff development programs to Supervisor.

  

**Requirements:**  

* BA or BS from accredited Social Work Program.
* Experience in Geriatrics healthcare.
* Certification by State of New Jersey (CSW) required.

title: Accounts Payable Specialist
description:
**ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SPECIALIST**

**Earn $20-$26/hr depending on experience**

Part-time 15 to 20 hours a week

Flexible schedule - Monday through Friday between 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM

For over 20 years, Community Care has been caring for individuals and families across New York state. We are a leading home health care agency offering both medical and non-medical services in the Western NY Region, Long Island, NYC Boroughs, Westchester County, and Lower Hudson Region. Our team consists of companions, personal care aides, home health aides, nurses, and more, providing support services that allow clients to remain independent at home. At Community Care, "We Care” about the people we work with just as much as the people we work for.

It is the responsibility of the Account Payroll Specialist at Community Care Home Health Services to support the Director of Financial Compliance and assist in all functions associated with the payments of vendors across all disciplines of the business. This position works closely with leaders of all departments such as Operations, Human Resources, IT, Finance, CDPAP, and Executive Management to ensure business needs are met and that vendors are paid accurately and timely.

**The candidate we seek will be responsible for:**

· Review, verify, enter, and upload vendor invoices into the system in compliance with financial policies and procedures.

· Maintain third-party procurement software and its interface into the operating system.

· Performs general ledger posting/coding of invoices while adhering to monthly close deadlines.

· Reconcile the accounts payable ledger to ensure that all bills and payments are accounted for and properly posted.

· Research and resolve invoice discrepancies and issues.

· Prepares invoice aging analysis for management review.

· Prepare and process check runs.

· Communicate with vendors to ensure statements are received and reconciled with department heads.

· Responsible for the organization and management of AP files for retrieval.

· Maintain positive external and internal employee relations.

· Maintain supply inventory for the corporate location.

· Maintain organization of equipment and lease agreements.

· Assist in the preparation and distribution of 1099 forms.

· Ensure timely response to audit/ad hoc requests.

· Perform any other duties as assigned by management.

**What we required from you…** 

· Three years of experience with accounts payable in a high-volume corporate setting

· Bachelor's degree desired but not required, contingent on level of experience.

· Proficient in data entry and management

· Solid understanding of accounting payable principles.

· Proven ability to calculate, post, and manage figures and financial records utilizing Excel spreadsheets and management software.

· Strong organization skills with attention to detail

· Ability to multi-task and meet close deadlines

· Excellent oral and written communication skills

· Knowledge of office practices and procedures.

· Knowledge of business terminology, spelling, punctuation, and grammar.

· Prepare and maintain accurate records and files.

· Ability to interpret and apply rules, regulations, policies, and procedures.

· Ability to coordinate with other staff, departments, officials, agencies, organizations, and the public.

· Ability to communicate ideas and instructions clearly and concisely.

· Strong working knowledge of computers and related equipment.

**Working Conditions & Physical Effort:**

· Work is normally performed in a typical interior/office work environment.

· Ability to work a flexible schedule and/or evening hours as needed.

· Ability to sit in front of a computer for long periods.

· Physical activity is sedentary and may require occasional lifting or carrying up to 10 lbs.

· Visual acuity is required.

**Become Part of the Community Care Family Today and Experience the Difference:**

· Competitive Pay Rates/Weekly Pay

· Direct Deposit

· Affordable Medical/Dental/Vision Plans

· Aflac – Life Insurance, Accident, Hospitalization, Cancer, and Disability Supplemental Plans

· Employee Discount Program – Fantastic saving on purchases, travel, movie tickets, events, shows, entertainment, etc.

· Paid Orientation, Training and In-service

· Employee Recognition Events

· Referral Bonus

We salute and thank you for your service to the community!

*“We Care.” This philosophy is ingrained in our company DNA. At Community Care our passion is our patients. We care about our patients, their families and our caregivers. Since 1986 we have been dedicated to providing the best home care and nursing services to those in need.*

Contact us today to become part of the Community Care family!

title: Director of Catering

description:
**Position Summary:** The Director of Catering coordinates, manages and administers the activities of the Catering Department in a manner to assure effective and friendly guest relationships.

**Core Responsibilities:**

 Solicit banquet and catering sales business, and receive and answer all inquiries relating to the catering department.

 Direct the activities of the catering department in an effort to obtain maximum profit from available business booked.

 Prepare and maintain reports of sales recaps, organization contacts, catering function book and catering file system.

 Maintain budgeted sales quotas, and create new ideas to increase catering revenue where required. Develop overall sales action plan for the catering/sales effort for all existing markets and prospect potential markets. Monitor specific action plans for each segment developed by the respective Catering Manager and ensure they achieve booking goals each month.

 Act in concert with hotel management team and property General Manager.

 Train, coordinate supervise, coach and counsel associates, including managers.

 Work with Executive Chef to ensure menus are updated routinely to meet guest demand.  Work closely with Sales team on upcoming events.

 Ensure Catering team is staffed appropriately, including interviewing, hiring, training and evaluating staff as needed.

 Perform all other duties as required by the General Manager.

**Knowledge, Skills, and Competencies:**

 Prior experience in Catering role, demonstrating success and ability to sell and service Catering events.

 Strong business communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written

 Strong computer skills in Microsoft Suite
